subject: REMINDER: 2FA coming to brand center
body:
Hello brand partners,
To continuously improve our security, on April 9th we will be introducing a two-factor authentication (2FA) step to access the brand center.
All external J&J partners will be required to enter a 6-digit identification code via the Google Authenticator app in addition to their password.
Please enable this feature now for uninterrupted access to the 
brand center
. 
Instructions to set up two-factor authentication
1. Download Google Authenticator
If you haven't already, download Google
Authenticator for free from the Apple App
Store or Google Play Store.
 
2. Access your account profile in the brand center 
Once logged in to the brand center, navigate to the bottom left of your screen to find the Frontify nook logo, click on the logo
 
Click your avatar on the bottom left corner 
(A)
Then, click on the pencil icon next to your name to edit profile 
(B)
﻿
 
In the side panel, scroll to the Security section
Under password, navigate to two-factor authentication and select enable
 
3. Set up two-factor authentication
A pop-up window will appear with set up instructions
Important note: the QR code is unique each time you enable two-factor authentication.
﻿
 
4. Link Google Authenticator to your account
Open the Google Authenticator app on your phone
Tap the plus sign [+] on the bottom right 
(A)
Select "Scan a QR code" 
(B)
 and scan the QR code from your computer screen in the pop-up window
﻿
 
5. Enter the verification code
Google Authenticator app will generate a 6-digit code labeled Frontify
Enter the 6-digit code shown in the set up window
Note: This code refreshes every 30 seconds.
You will also be provided a confirmation window containing 10 unique recovery codes. Copy and store these codes somewhere safe.
You'll need these codes if you lose access to your phone or switch devices.
 
6. Confirm two-factor authentication is enabled
Once enabled, a green circle will appear next to two-factor authentication, confirming activation
 
To download these instructions for future reference, you can find the PDF 
here
*
.
*This document is only accessible through the brand center. If it is not downloaded before two-factor authentication is turned on, it will not be available.
If you have any questions, email us at 
JJbrandhelp@its.jnj.com
.

subject: Request to update ACH instructions for Language & Culture Worldwide LLC (#95173)
body:
New Procedure for Updating ACH instructions – Effective February 13, 2025.
 
Dear Accounting Team at LCW   ,
 
In addition to having the form filled out with it’s accompaning supporting documenation (IE a voided check).  Lendlease has implemented a new procedure for updating ACH instructions and creating new ACH accounts.
 
To ensure compliance, please follow these steps.
 
The Master Data Manager will contact the authorized user of the bank account to verify account details.  The process will include:  
Confirming that the individual on the call is an authorized user of the establshiment’s bank account.
Validating the banking instructions associated with the account.
Ensuring the account is current and complete.
 
 
To proceed, please call 704-357-6551, you may set up a time and date first, with me through email, if you’d prefer.
 
Best Regards,
 
 
Jessica M. Hernández

subject: Celebrating a Milestone: CST is Now a Certified B Corp!
body:
Dear Clients and Friends,
Big News!
 
We are thrilled to announce that 
Culture Shift Team
 (CST) is now a Certified B Corporation! This achievement is not just a milestone—it’s a reaffirmation of our core mission to use business as a force for good.
Our Journey:
 Our journey began in September 2022 when we undertook the B Corp Assessment—a rigorous evaluation of our impact on our workers, customers, community, and environment. After 915 days of diligent effort and dedication, we achieved a score of 85.6, officially making us a B Corp just in time to celebrate B Corp Month!
What This Means:
 Achieving B Corp status means that CST meets the highest standards of verified social and environmental performance, public transparency, and legal accountability. We are committed to:
Social and Environmental Impact:
 Elevating our initiatives to create positive impacts both locally and globally. 
Transparency:
 Upholding an open and honest relationship with our stakeholders. 
Accountability:
 Ensuring we are accountable for our impacts on our employees, communities, and the environment. 
Thrilled to Join Global Leaders:
 As an advertising, marketing, and inclusive workplace culture firm, we are thrilled to join the global B Corp community alongside companies like Ben & Jerry's, Danone North America, Patagonia, TOMS, and Warby Parker. These companies have set benchmarks in their respective industries, and we are excited to contribute to this movement of responsible and sustainable business practices. 
Looking Ahead:
 We are excited to continue this journey, striving for improvement and making a lasting impact in every area of our business. 
Thank You:
 We would like to extend a heartfelt thank you to our team, clients, and partners who have been instrumental in this process. Your support fuels our continued commitment to define and embody the future of business excellence. 
Thank you for celebrating with us this new achievement!
Warm regards,
Marcela Gómez
CEO
Culture Shift Team, Inc.
marcela.gomez@cultureshiftteam.com
615-828-0987

click here
.

subject: 👀 The hidden message in your video background
body:
Your virtual presence sends signals—are they the right ones?
 
View this email in your browser
 
Your virtual presence sends signals -
are they the right ones?
 
Blurred? Branded? Revealing?
Your video background is saying more than you think.
In 2025, 
virtual presence
 is no longer optional - it’s a critical leadership skill.
And your video background?
It’s a subtle, but powerful, part of that presence.
💡 What the research says:
▪️ Neutral backgrounds can signal competence - but may feel cold.
▪️ Personalized backgrounds increase warmth and connection.
▪️ Warmth boosts perceptions of service quality - 
without hurting your credibility.
▪️ BUT: Avoid polarizing visuals (🕷️ 🐍) - they distract and can backfire.
 
No perfect setup? No problem.
▪️You don't need a magazine-worthy home office to build connection.
▪️A thoughtfully crafted 
virtual
 background can still reflect who you are—your values, interests, or personality.
👉 Try this: add a favorite quote or a favorite image to your virtual background to create a personal touch.
It’s not about perfection - it’s about being intentional.
𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝗯𝗶𝗴 𝗽𝗶𝗰𝘁𝘂𝗿𝗲.
Virtual leadership requires 
thoughtful digital presence.
 
Knowing how to influence, engage, and build relationships through a screen is a competitive advantage.
I’ve been leading distributed teams while working remotely for over 14 years.
I use my video background to humanize virtual interactions - family photos, travel momentos, artwork, and hobbies spark conversation and connection.
Your action step:
Take 2 minutes to audit your video background.
Ask yourself:
✔️ Does it reflect 
who I am
, not just 
what I do
?
✔️ What change could I make to show up in a way that builds both connection 
and
 credibility?
Ready to take your virtual presence further?
▪️Thousands have built their Personal Virtual Exposure and Influence Plan with us.
👉 
Join the waitlist
 for our next workshop and start building yours.
Have a great week!
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
P.S. 
 Want to learn more about using video as a tool of influence? 
Check out this article
. 
Join the Waitlist
 
Strengthening Connections and Visibility Across Distance
“The action plan I created during Virtual Work Insider’s 
Build Your Network and Exposure Across Distance
 workshop had an immediate and lasting impact.
Within a month, I had already deepened connections with senior leaders across time zones and expanded my local network. By organizing in-person meetups, I increased my visibility within the division and uncovered new career opportunities.
These strategies continue to boost my confidence, influence, and ability to navigate remote work effectively. The workshop provided a clear, actionable roadmap to grow my network and advance my career in a geographically distributed organization.”
Dixit Gandhi
TPM Business Consultant
TELUS Agriculture & Consumer Goods
Join the Waitlist
 
Our Insider knowledge can help your organization build the skills, behaviors, and mindsets critical to being effective in a distributed, hybrid or remote work environment.

subject: Culture Shift Team Invites you to Download the Free Guide on the Current Landscape of Corporate DEI Commitment
body:
Dear Dan, 
As the business environment evolves amid increasing social and political challenges, the commitment to Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) becomes more critical than ever. While some high-profile companies like Meta, John Deere, and Walmart have reevaluated their DEI efforts, it's important to recognize that the core values of DEI remain indispensable, especially for globally focused organizations. 
CST’s Latest Resource:
 We've released a primer on "The Current Landscape of Corporate DEI Commitment" that sheds light on how major corporations are navigating these changes. Despite some companies scaling back, an overwhelming majority of Fortune 500 companies remain steadfast in their commitment, driven by the tangible benefits DEI brings to talent management, employee engagement, and bottom-line profitability. 
Why This Guide? Our comprehensive guide is designed to help you understand:
Rebranding DEI: A Strategy or a Retreat?
 Explore why some companies are rebranding their DEI initiatives and the implications of such changes. 
Short-Term Gains vs. Long-Term Consequences:
 Analyze the immediate benefits and potential lasting impacts of scaling back DEI efforts. 
The Role of Corporate Leadership in Shaping DEI:
 Discover how leadership decisions influence the direction and effectiveness of DEI strategies. 
The Internal Effect of Disengagement:
 Understand how reducing commitment to DEI can affect employee morale and corporate culture. 
2025 Recommended Approach to Organizational Inclusion:
 Learn about the forward-thinking strategies to foster a more inclusive organizational environment. 
Download Your Free Guide: Embrace a strategic, integrated approach to safeguard and promote your corporate values and competitiveness in a global business environment. Click below to access our free guide and start enhancing your DEI commitment today.
Download the Corporate DEI Commitment Guide
CST is a leading consultancy specializing in Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion (DEI) strategies that foster inclusive and equitable environments within organizations. At CST, we understand that true change comes from thoughtfully designed strategies that address systemic inequities head-on. Our services range from comprehensive DEI assessments and customized training programs to strategic planning and implementation that ensure sustainable cultural transformation. 
We work closely with each client to create environments where diverse talents are valued, and inclusive practices are woven into the fabric of everyday business operations. Our goal is to empower organizations to not only meet but exceed their DEI objectives, driving innovation and enhancing corporate reputation by truly embracing the power of diversity. 
Warm regards,
Robert Lawrence Wilson
robert.wilson@cultureshiftteam.com
Chief Strategy Officer

subject: Support UChicago Graduate Students on Giving Day, March 25, 2025
body:
Dear Daniel,
 
I hope this message finds you well. Having served on a panel at 
GRADUCon
, UChicagoGRAD’s annual career conference, you know the value of our programs in shaping the careers of graduate students and postdocs. We are grateful for your support, and now we’re reaching out with another opportunity to empower current graduate students and postdocs. 
 
For the first time, UChicagoGRAD is participating in UChicago’s
 
annual
 
Giving Day
 
campaign. Coincidentally, UChicagoGRAD is also celebrating its tenth birthday this year! By donating on March 25, 2025, you can not only sustain events like GRADUCon, but you can also support a wide range of other UChicagoGRAD initiatives that have grown over the past ten years. From providing career advising and professional development workshops to fostering social and academic community, UChicagoGRAD is dedicated to connecting graduate students and postdocs with alumni, each other, and the resources they need to succeed in an ever-evolving professional landscape.  
 
Beyond Giving Day, you can support UChicagoGRAD by hosting 
internships
 or 
externships
, 
recruiting
 graduate and postdoctoral talent to your organization, or conducting informational interviews with current students.
 
On March 25, we hope you will consider a contribution—any amount is appreciated—to support UChicagoGRAD resources, which are in demand now more than ever. 
 
Sincerely, 
Courtney 
 
Courtney Wiersema, PhD
Senior Director, Professional Development and Outreach
 
UChicagoGRAD 
The University of Chicago
Bookstore Building
970 E. 58th Street   Room 350E   Chicago, IL 60637

subject: This Giving Day, UChicagoGRAD is Turning 10!
body:
Countdown to Giving Day: One Week!
 
We're celebrating ten years of UChicagoGRAD!
UChicagoGRAD launched in 2015 with the mission of expanding support for graduate student and postdoc success at UChicago and beyond. Over the past ten years, we have evolved to meet the ever-changing needs of our community, and today, we are an essential part of the campus experience. Fostering connections through co-curricular programming, student advising, and community-building initiatives like the new Graduate Student Lounge, UChicagoGRAD is a beloved resource. 
Give to UChicagoGRAD
This Giving Day (March 25-26), please consider donating to UChicagoGRAD priorities: the 
professional development fund
 and the 
graduate life fund
. You are part of this community and central to our mission. Your generosity will keep our community thriving for decades to come!  
Check out our campaigns! 
 
If you would like to get involved with UChicagoGRAD, please send your contact information or connect with us on LinkedIn. We will reach out again before Giving Day  and hope you will consider a contribution—any amount is appreciated—to support UChicagoGRAD resources, which are in demand now more than ever.

subject: eMP/Ariba Performance Issues - Update on Resolution Efforts
body:
________________________________________
We are pleased to announce that the connection issues between Fieldglass and eMP/Ariba, which arose after recent security enhancements, have been fully resolved.

However, a significant backlog of cases remains. We are prioritizing requests based on submission dates and are diligently working to clear this backlog. Currently, we are processing cases submitted from mid-January to late January and aim to return to a steady state by the end of March. We appreciate your patience during this time.
Please continue submitting requests as soon as needs arise, as we process them in order of submission. We recommend submitting requests before identifying suppliers or resources to ensure proper classification and the best pricing. Ideally, submissions should be made at least 30 days before the required purchase order (PO).
To help us manage the backlog, if you have not received a response from a Worksense representative within 10 days of your submission, please contact Tasha Pernazza at TPernazz@its.jnj.com for a status update. This will allow our team to focus on processing current requests.
Rest assured, resolving this matter is our top priority. Additionally, please note that SOW workers do not enter timesheets in Fieldglass and are not affected by this issue.

Thank you for your continued support and understanding.

(JNJN, insite-agent09-0,  z25031013072665584370605)

subject: 🤔 Are you asking the right person for help?
body:
Tactics to overcome recency bias.
 
 
Hi Dan,
Think about your most important project.
Who’s the first person you’d go to for input?
Was one of the first people you thought of, one of the last people that you've heard from or seen? 
Yes or no?
Chances are, you answered yes.
It's probably someone you’ve seen or heard from recently...
...But is that the 
best
 person to go to?
The Bias at Play
Our brains rely on mental shortcuts, but those shortcuts can sometimes work against us—
especially in geographically distributed, hybrid and remote teams.
Two unconscious biases could be shaping your decisions without you even realizing it:
🔹 
Recency Bias
 – We prioritize what’s 
recent
 over what’s 
relevant
.
🔹 
Distance Bias
 – We favor people 
physically closer
 to us, even if they’re not the best fit for the task.
Why This Matters
When we let these biases drive our decisions, we risk:
❌ Overlooking key collaborators who aren’t top of mind.
❌ Missing out on the right expertise.
How to Combat These Biases
Here are three simple tactics we teach as part of our training programs to help mitigate these biases and build even more effective distributed teams:
 
✅ 
Pause & Ponder
 – Before moving forward, ask yourself: 
Am I reaching out to the right person - or just the most recent one?
 
✅ 
Create a Visual Cue
 – Post a team photo or org chart at your workstation. A small visual reminder can help you expand your mental network.
✅ 
Build Virtual Watercoolers
 – Use Slack, Teams, or other collaboration tools to create informal spaces for connection beyond your immediate circle.
The Takeaway
Don’t default to who’s closest or who you heard from most recently - choose who’s best.
This small shift can transform your, and your team’s, effectiveness.
Want to learn more about how our training programs can empower your geographically distributed, hybrid, and remote teams with the skills to work more effectively together across distance?
Reply to this email, or
Schedule 30 minutes
 with me
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider

I’m making progress on my upcoming book with Georgetown University Press, 
From Resistance to Results: The Psychology of Generative AI Integration
. You can check out the book proposal
 
here
.
The publisher is particularly interested in real-world case studies of how organizations with over 20 people are integrating generative AI.

subject: Last Chance to Register for our Reset or Retreat? Reimagining the Business of Inclusion for 2025 and Beyond
body:
I hope this message finds you well. This is your last chance to join me and Luther Wright, Managing Shareholder at Ogletree Deakins’ Nashville Office, for an engaging free webinar on the future of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Belonging (DEIAB). You have only one more day to register!
The current landscape is at a crossroads. With federal executive orders and legal challenges directly targeting DEI programs, many organizations are rethinking their strategies amidst growing scrutiny, skepticism, and strategic rollbacks. Workforce expectations and market demands continue to evolve, forcing us to ask: do we reset and push forward—or retreat under pressure?
Webinar Details:
Date: March 5, 2025 
Time: 12:00 to 1:00 PM CST 
Location: Live on Zoom 
Please register for FREE to be part of this critical dialogue:
https://bit.ly/Reset-or-Retreat-Webinar
 
During our 
Reset or Retreat? Reimagining the Business of Inclusion for 2025 and Beyond webinar
 we will explore: 
How organizations can adapt their strategies while mitigating legal risks.
Ways to balance regulatory compliance with a genuine commitment to inclusion.
Strategies for maintaining momentum in the face of shifting regulations and mounting political pressure.
I believe that by sharing expert insights and practical strategies, we can collectively build sustainable approaches to drive inclusive growth despite these evolving challenges.
I look forward to connecting with you and discussing how we can navigate this complex landscape together.
Warm regards,
Robert Lawrence Wilson
robert.wilson@cultureshiftteam.com
Chief Strategy Officer
Inclusive Workplace Culture Expert
Culture Shift Team, Inc.

subject: Free Webinar: Reset or Retreat? Reimagining the Business of Inclusion for 2025 and Beyond
body:
I hope this message finds you well. I am writing to personally invite you to join me and Luther Wright, Managing Shareholder at Ogletree Deakins’ Nashville Office, for an engaging free webinar on the future of Diversity, Equity, Inclusion, Accessibility, and Belonging (DEIAB).
The current landscape is at a crossroads. With federal executive orders and legal challenges directly targeting DEI programs, many organizations are rethinking their strategies amidst growing scrutiny, skepticism, and strategic rollbacks. Workforce expectations and market demands continue to evolve, forcing us to ask: do we reset and push forward—or retreat under pressure?
Join us on March 5, 2025, from 12:00 to 1:00 PM CST for this free live webinar on Zoom.
Please register for FREE to be part of this critical dialogue:
https://bit.ly/Reset-or-Retreat-Webinar
 
During our Reset or Retreat? Reimagining the Business of Inclusion for 2025 and Beyond webinar we will explore: 
How organizations can adapt their strategies while mitigating legal risks.
Ways to balance regulatory compliance with a genuine commitment to inclusion.
Strategies for maintaining momentum in the face of shifting regulations and mounting political pressure.
I believe that by sharing expert insights and practical strategies, we can collectively build sustainable approaches to drive inclusive growth despite these evolving challenges.
I look forward to connecting with you and discussing how we can navigate this complex landscape together.
Warm regards,
Robert Lawrence Wilson
robert.wilson@cultureshiftteam.com
Chief Strategy Officer
Inclusive Workplace Culture Expert
Culture Shift Team, Inc.
To unsubscribe from future Culture Shift Team emails, please 
click here
.

subject: Seeking case studies of Gen AI adoption for my book with Georgetown U Press
body:
Looking for Gen AI case studies for my new book 
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Greetings Dan,
Exciting news—I’ve secured a book contract with Georgetown University Press for a book titled 
From Resistance to Results: The Psychology of Generative AI Integration
. You can read the book proposal
 
here
.
The publisher is interested in real-world case studies on how organizations with over 20 people are adopting generative AI.
 I’m looking to interview leaders or other stakeholders who have insights to share.
If you know someone who might be interested, I’d love an introduction! These case studies will be featured in the book and also inform articles I write for 
Forbes
, 
Entrepreneur
, 
Fast Company
, 
The World Financial Review
, and 
Fortune
.
Think you can help me out?
Decisively yours,
Dr. Gleb

CEO of Disaster Avoidance Experts

subject: Exclusive: Allstate, Airbnb & Zillow’s Top Distributed Work Lessons
body:
Take action by 2/28
 
View this email in your browser
 
Leading a Distributed Team?
Register for April 29-30th.
 
Working across distance can be tough.
Learn what works (and what doesn’t) - live in Austin!
The best leaders experiment, learn and refine.
That’s why I’m excited to invite you to 
Running Remote 2025
 
(April 29-30) in Austin, Texas.
I’ll be leading a high-impact panel discussion...
🌹 
Roses & 🌵 Thorns: Practical Tactics for Enterprise Teams to Work Across Distance
I’ll be joined by top enterprise leaders shaping the future of remote, hybrid, and distributed work:
🎤 
Allstate:
 Lauren DeYoung, Work Futurist
🎤 
Zillow: 
Darren Murph, Senior Director, Cloud-HQ
🎤 
Airbnb: 
Karrah Phillips, EX Program Manager
We’ll break down:
🌵 
Thorns 
- what didn’t work: the pitfalls we’ve faced and the lessons we've learned.
🌹 
Roses 
- what’s working now: tested strategies that drive connection, collaboration & accountability.
Topics we’ll cover:
🔹 Connection & Trust
🔹 Communication, Collaboration & Coordination
🔹 Accountability & Decision-Making
What you’ll get:
✅ Tactical, real-world strategies you can apply immediately.
🎟 
Save an extra 20% 
on tickets when you 
use my promo link
.
Act now before the 
price increases on 
2/28!
Accelerate your learning with actionable strategies from leaders 
who are in the trenches, making distributed work successful at scale.
Will I see you there?  
Hit reply if you have questions.
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
P.S. 
This is your 
exclusive chance
 to hear from these experts together on one stage!
P.P.S.
  Other 
thought leaders you will learn from
 include: preeminent researchers Nick Bloom (Stanford) and Raj Choudhury (Harvard), practitioners and experts Brian Elliott (Work Forward), Ryan Anderson (MillerKnoll), Izabella Lorenz (Zoom), Chase Warrington (Doist).
 
Register with extra 20% Discount
 
Delivering Results for Distributed, Hybrid, and Remote Teams
“We hired Virtual Work Insider to deliver a training workshop series to the leadership team that is responsible for the Optum Southern California Patient Service Center call center. The comprehensive hybrid team leadership skills program was delivered over the course of several months and empowered our people leaders with the skills to create their hybrid team working norms, build their hybrid team culture, and work effectively with their remote and hybrid direct reports.
The beauty of the program is that the techniques and tools that Virtual Work Insider teaches aren’t too complex – they are easy to implement, and they make an impact. The sessions were highly customized to Optum and kept the team engaged. Between sessions, the Virtual Work Insider team provided us with additional thought leadership and advice to ensure we were taking action on our commitments.”
 
Susan Graham
Vice President,
Patient Support and Contact Center
Optum
Our Insider knowledge can help your organization build the skills, behaviors, and mindsets critical to being effective in a distributed, hybrid or remote work environment.
Skills Programs & Interactive Keynotes: 
Virtual Leadership Foundations: mitigating distance bias and recency bias; creating team communication norms and rituals
Leading Effective and Inclusive Hybrid & Remote Meetings
The Art of Successful Virtual Reporting Relationships
Driving Culture in Distributed Teams
Building Exposure and Influence Across Distance
Contact Us
 
Copyright © 2025 Virtual Work Insider. All rights reserved.

body:

Secure your spot at the IB Global Conference, New Orleans 2025!
After a sold-out conference in Washington, D.C., USA, we are excited to return to the Americas (AM) region! This event welcomes leading education professionals from schools, universities and governments.
Taking place at the 
New Orleans Marriott
 from 
15–17 July 2025
, this conference will be a unique opportunity to meet face-to-face with key decision-makers and educators from all over the world.
Our sponsor and exhibitor packages come with a variety of opportunities to showcase your brand and maximise your impact. Details can be found in the exhibitor prospectus. 
 
Download prospectus
 
 
 
Why should you participate?
Brand Visibility and Recognition:
 Showcase your products to more than 1,700 passionate educators who are excited to discover resources and materials that support them in their careers.
Networking Opportunities:
 Engage with 300 school leaders and decision-makers to discover potential business relationships.
Targeted Audience Reach:
 Ensure that your message reaches the relevant audience by connecting directly with Heads of Schools, programme coordinators and teachers during the conference.
Lead Generation:
 Leverage the conference app and lead capture technology to engage with decision-makers and generate high-quality leads.
Customer Engagement:
 Strengthen relationships with your existing customers by connecting through face-to-face interactions.
Feedback and Market Research:
 Gain valuable feedback on your products or services and insights into market needs and perceptions.
Register here
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
© International Baccalaureate Organization 2025
International Baccalaureate®  |  Baccalauréat International®  |  Bachillerato Internacional®
 
This email is sent from an account we use for sending messages only and is not monitored for replies. If you would like to get in touch with us, please visit our 
Ask a question
 page for contact details.
 
 
 
 
Forward 
 
International Baccalaureate
Rue du Pré-de-la-Bichette 1  |  1202  |  Geneva, Switzerland

subject: Kohler - IMPORTANT User Account Upgrade : LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC / Kohler - WICHTIG Upgrade des Benutzerkontos: LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
body:
Dear LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
You are receiving this email because you have an active profile on the Kohler Supplier Management Platform.
We are excited to announce two new enhancements to our Supplier Management Platform (Powered by Jaggaer), which will provide added levels of security to protect your data.
Supplier Identity Management (IDM)
Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA).
This upgrade is in line with industry standards and aims to provide you with the necessary tools to protect your account.
Supplier Identify Manager will also enable you to manage multiple accounts with us if you’re managing separate divisions or global operations with Kohler.
When is this happening?
This enhancement will be effective from 
10
th
 February 2025
.
What actions are required from you?
The next time you log in to your profile, you will see the message 
“Your Account Has Been Upgraded to JAGGAER Global Identity”
You will be prompted to reset your password.
 This will come from no-reply@jaggaer.com
Please follow the step-by-step instructions in the attached document to complete this process
Portal Link:
https://app11.jaggaer.com/portal/kohlerco/?pp_login=1&cid=225221
If you have any questions please contact 
SMPSupport@kohler.com
Thank you for being a Kohler Valuable Supplier,
Kohler Global Procurement
Ref: Document - Documents Notification - Supplier IDM
 
--------------
Sehr geehrter geschätzter Lieferant
LANGUAGE & CULTURE WORLDWIDE LLC
Sie erhalten diese E-Mail, weil Sie ein aktives Profil auf der Kohler Supplier Management Platform besitzen.
Wir freuen uns, zwei neue Verbesserungen an unserer Supplier Management Platform (Powered by Jaggaer) anzukündigen, die zusätzliche Sicherheitsebenen bieten, um Ihre Daten zu schützen.
Lieferanten-Identitätsmanagement (IDM)
Mehrfaktor-Authentifizierung (MFA).
Dieses Upgrade entspricht den Branchenstandards und soll Ihnen die notwendigen Tools bieten, um Ihr Konto zu schützen.
Der Supplier Identity Manager wird es Ihnen auch ermöglichen, mehrere Konten bei uns zu verwalten, falls Sie separate Abteilungen oder globale Geschäftsbereiche von Kohler betreuen.
Wann passiert das?
Diese Verbesserung wird ab dem 
10. Februar 2025
 wirksam.
Welche Maßnahmen sind von Ihnen erforderlich?
Das nächste Mal, wenn Sie sich in Ihr Profil einloggen, werden Sie die Nachricht 
„Ihr Konto wurde auf JAGGAER Globale Identität aktualisiert“ 
sehen.
Sie werden aufgefordert, Ihr Passwort zurückzusetzen.
 Diese Aufforderung kommt von 
no-reply@jaggaer.com
Bitte folgen Sie den Schritt-für-Schritt-Anweisungen im beigefügten Dokument, um diesen Prozess abzuschließen.
Portal Link:
https://app11.jaggaer.com/portal/kohlerco/?pp_login=1&cid=225221
 
Wenn Sie Fragen haben oder Unterstützung benötigen, wenden Sie sich bitte an  
SMPSupport@kohler.com 
Mit freundlichen Grüßen,
Kohler Global Procurement 
Ref: Document - Documents Notification - Supplier IDM

subject: Inside BLUE KNIGHT™: Reflections, Insights, and Advice
body:
Angela Specht shares learnings from her first 90 days
View in browser
 
 
Dear Dan,
As we step into 2025, the team at BLUE KNIGHT™ is brimming with energy and excitement for the journey ahead. Time truly flies when you’re immersed in meaningful work, and I’m thrilled to reflect on my first 90 days as Global Lead, BARDA Alliance. It’s been an inspiring start, and I’m eager to share my insights on the program’s impact and opportunities to drive even greater progress.
 
In my latest 
blog post
, I delve into these early reflections—what surprised me, the transformative innovations emerging from 
Blue Knight
 companies, and my vision for the program’s future over the next year and beyond. The possibilities are as inspiring as they are boundless.
 
As we launch into this new year, the enthusiasm at 
Blue Knight
 is tangible. I warmly invite you to join us on this thrilling journey by participating in our events, challenges, and initiatives. Stay tuned for details on the 2025 
Blue Knight
 Symposium, which will be announced soon.
 
Keep reading for updates from 
Blue Knight
 companies as we continue to pioneer the future of innovation together.
 
Angela Specht 
Global Lead, BARDA Alliance, Johnson & Johnson Innovation – JLABS

subject: How to entice people to the office?
body:
Hi Dan,
I often get asked, “How do we entice people back to the office?”
Here’s the truth: that’s the wrong question. Instead, we should be asking...
👉 “𝗛𝗼𝘄 𝗱𝗼 𝘄𝗲 𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗼𝘄𝗲𝗿 𝗲𝗺𝗽𝗹𝗼𝘆𝗲𝗲𝘀 𝘁𝗼 𝘄𝗼𝗿𝗸 𝘁𝗼𝗴𝗲𝘁𝗵𝗲𝗿 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗹𝘆, 𝗻𝗼 𝗺𝗮𝘁𝘁𝗲𝗿 𝘄𝗵𝗲𝗿𝗲 𝘁𝗵𝗲𝘆 𝗮𝗿𝗲?”
This shift in mindset has transformed how I approach leadership and collaboration.
It’s not about choosing between in-person, hybrid, or remote.
𝘐𝘵’𝘴 𝘢𝘣𝘰𝘶𝘵 𝘮𝘢𝘴𝘵𝘦𝘳𝘪𝘯𝘨 𝘢𝘭𝘭 𝘰𝘧 𝘵𝘩𝘦𝘴𝘦 𝘮𝘰𝘥𝘦𝘴.
It’s about fostering what I call, 𝗢𝗺𝗻𝗶𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗮𝗹 𝗟𝗲𝗮𝗱𝗲𝗿𝘀𝗵𝗶𝗽...
...the ability to be equally successful with
✅ communicating,
✅ collaborating,
✅ influencing,
✅ building relationships...
within
✅ a fully in-person group
✅ in a hybrid or distributed environment
✅ or a fully remote group…
🚀 𝗔𝗻𝗱 𝘀𝗲𝗮𝗺𝗹𝗲𝘀𝘀𝗹𝘆 𝘀𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗰𝗵𝗶𝗻𝗴 𝗯𝗲𝘁𝘄𝗲𝗲𝗻 𝗺𝘂𝗹𝘁𝗶𝗽𝗹𝗲 𝗺𝗼𝗱𝗲𝘀, 𝗲𝘃𝗲𝗻 𝘄𝗶𝘁𝗵𝗶𝗻 𝘁𝗵𝗲 𝘀𝗮𝗺𝗲 𝗱𝗮𝘆!
𝗧𝗵𝗲 𝘁𝗮𝗸𝗲𝗮𝘄𝗮𝘆: Have patience with yourself and your team.
The learning journey to work effectively across all of these modes will take time, training, practice, and role modeling!
Interested in learning how our training programs can empower your hybrid, distributed, and remote teams with the skills to work more effectively across these modes?
Reply to this email, or
Schedule 30 minutes
 with me
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider

LA Strong
SUPPORTING COMMUNITIES IMPACTED BY WILDFIRES
With a fifth of our team based in Los Angeles and countless friends and family who call it home, LA holds a special place in our hearts. 
The recent wildfires have brought immense challenges to the region, deeply affecting many local businesses, including our brand partners and neighbors. At Goody, we’re committed to supporting this vibrant community in every way we can. 
One meaningful way you can join us is by shopping small and local. We’re proud to partner with over a dozen incredible LA-based businesses that could truly use your support right now.

subject: CORRECTION: 2024 Year in Review
body:
This email has been corrected and is being redistributed to amend an error in the prior reference to V-Wave and VELYS™ SPINE. 
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page
 
here
.
2024 Year in review
This email has been corrected and is being redistributed to amend an error in the prior reference to V-Wave and VELYS™ SPINE.
 
Dear Colleagues,
In a dynamic healthcare market, Johnson & Johnson’s corporate venture capital organization remained steadfast in our commitment to investing in transformative healthcare solutions throughout 2024. We focused on identifying and nurturing promising biotech and medtech companies across all stages, from early-stage investments to supporting successful exits. 
This year underscored the strength of our long-term strategy, exemplified by the acquisition of V-Wave, a company we initially backed in 2016. Through the longevity of this relationship, we developed a deep understanding of V-Wave’s cardiovascular implant technology and a shared commitment to patients living with heart failure, and are now able to advance this technology within J&J at a pivotal stage of its evolution. Similarly, our early investment in eCential Robotics and its surgical robotic technology enabled this year’s launch of VELYS™ SPINE, the first active spine robotics and navigation platform that we could integrate with existing J&J MedTech Spine products.
We also celebrated significant milestones for our portfolio companies, including AbbVie's acquisition of Aliada Therapeutics (co-founded by JJDC) and Rapport Therapeutics' successful IPO. Additionally, our biotech portfolio had exceptional outcomes with the acquisition of Arkuda Therapeutics, an investigational portfolio of progranulin modulating small molecules with a potential first-in-class differentiated mechanism. 
Despite a challenging IPO market characterized by increased scrutiny of valuations, JJDC maintained a robust investment pace. Our ability to navigate market fluctuations stems from our strategy of investing off our strong balance sheet, allowing us to capitalize on strategically sound opportunities regardless of market conditions. We continued to lead and participate in funding rounds, recognizing the long-term potential of innovative companies even amidst market uncertainty. This proactive approach positioned us for success and provided for healthy portfolio exits such as JJDC-backed Fusion Pharmaceuticals and Calypso by AstraZeneca and Novartis, respectively. 
Looking forward to 2025, we are energized by the exciting therapeutic and technological advancements emerging globally and are excited to participate in what is sure to be another dynamic J.P. Morgan Healthcare Conference. And as part of J&J, the world's most innovative healthcare company, we will continue to boldly invest in the best of Health&Care for every provider, patient, and person. We will persist to nurture companies, supporting their development, and leveraging our unique capabilities to bring transformative solutions to healthcare professionals and patients. Because we're in this for the long haul, we are committed to seeing success through the most promising innovations in Health&Care. 
To learn more about our successes over the past year, read JJDC’s 2024 newsletter in full: 
 
Chris Picariello
President, Johnson & Johnson Innovation – JJDC, Inc.

subject: Encouraging News for 2025
body:
Why DEI will continue - and more!
 
The Spectra Diversity and Inclusion Profile™ provides valuable DEI data in one, easy 10 minute assessment. 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Encouraging News for 2025
Although the 2024 election results may reshape work for those of us working in diversity, equity and inclusion, Spectra Diversity has some 
bright spots
 to share from our colleagues who are doing DEI work.
Effenus Henderson’s article on 
McDonalds and the Backbone of DEI
. He describes how DEI is a dynamic process that requires constant recalibration.
Paolo Guardiano’s article on putting the “I” in DEI first by identifying the 
direct, tangible benefits of inclusion
.
James Felton Keith’s of Inclusion Score Inc.’s article titled “
DEI Supports Capitalism: Inclusion As A Driver Of Profitability And Innovation
”
Amy Waninger of Lead at Any Level has this engaging article: “
5 Reasons Not to Focus on Inclusive Leadership in 2025
”. You’ll need to read this one to understand the title!
Tawana Bhagwat of Organization at its Best, wrote about 
Finding Your Calm in the Chaos.
Chris Jones of Spectra Diversity adds to the mix with encouragement to 
Wake Up and Stay Woke!
Let's Make a Difference Together
 Your participation is crucial in shaping a future where every individual feels valued and included. Share this opportunity with your team and network to amplify the impact of our collective efforts in fostering inclusive cultures.
Thank you for your commitment to making inclusivity a core part of your leadership journey. 
Schedule a Virtual Coffee with Chris Jones
 
 
Spectra Diversity is gathering data on employee perceptions held by employees of different faiths within organizations. It's encouraging to see various faiths coexisting in this 500-person organization.
 
What is the Spectra Assessment?
The 
Spectra Diversity Inclusion Assessment
™
 measures diversity, equity and inclusion in one, easy 10-minute assessment.  
Get the kind of statistically validated data that will help your team develop DEI strategies to build an inclusive workplace culture.
 
Schedule a Free Demo

subject: Does your staffing provider put you at risk?
body:
Employbridge goes above and beyond to confirm the eligibility of our workforce.
 
Some staffing providers do the bare minimum to verify their workers’ employment eligibility.
Not Employbridge. We go above and beyond with a two-step process to confirm our talent are allowed to work in the United States.
•    EMP Trust to ensure the accuracy of Form 1-9 paperwork, including age
•    E-Verify at onboarding, which compares information from an employee's
 
Form I-9 to records from the U.S. Department of Homeland Security and the Social Security Administration.
 
You can feel confident in the workforce Employbridge places with you.
 
Contact us to 
learn more
 about our process and how it can benefit you.
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097

subject: eMP/Ariba Performance Issues - Update on Resolution Efforts
body:
eMP/Ariba Performance Issues

Update on Resolution Efforts

We would like to update you on the performance issues affecting the connection between Fieldglass and eMP/Ariba following recent security enhancements.

Unfortunately, the code optimization implemented in December did not fully resolve the performance issues. These ongoing performance issues continue to impact our ability to generate new POs and to clear the current backlog of POs. Our teams are prioritizing requests based on their submission time and working diligently to clear the backlog as quickly as possible. We understand the frustration this situation has caused and are taking steps with the vendors to resolve the issues as quickly as possible.

To allow the teams to dedicate themselves to clearing the backlog, if you would like to check the status of your request, please reach out directly to Tasha Pernazza at TPernazz@its.jnj.com.  This will allow the rest of the team to remain focused on processing the current backlog and avoid the need for frequent computer restarts while also allowing us to address your questions as quickly as possible. 

In collaboration with Johnson & Johnson and SAP, we remain hopeful that they are close to a solution that will mitigate the issues and allow us to return to normal processing. As of today, the development team at Fieldglass believes they have identified the root cause and are testing potential solutions. This represents a positive step toward addressing the slowness and related errors we've encountered.

Rest assured, resolving this matter remains our top priority, particularly as it pertains to ensuring the staff augmentation workforce can record their time accurately. It’s also important to note SOW workers do not enter timesheets in Fieldglass, so in those cases the issue is not impacting individual workers. 


Thank you for your ongoing support and understanding.

(JNJN, insite-agent09-0,  z250113212608443829272e9)

subject: Your "Winter Arc" for professional fitness
body:
Small steps for distributed work success
 
 
Hi Dan,
As we start the new year, many of us set physical fitness goals—
but what about professional fitness
? 
Inspired by the 
Winter Arc
—a sustainable approach to building wellness habits—you can apply this framework to thrive in distributed, hybrid, and remote work environments.
Why This Matters
 
Teams are becoming increasingly geographically distributed. Adapting isn’t just about 
where
 you work—it’s about 
how 
you work. Small, intentional actions can unlock big improvements in:
Productivity
Collaboration
Innovation
Engagement
 
Your Winter Arc: 
Examples of Simple Steps
🛠️ 
Experiment with Async Communication
Replace one FYI meeting this week with a "
video mail
." Save time and still communicate important information with full context. 
🌍 
Map Your Team’s Geography
Use this template
 to visualize your teammates' time zones and schedules.
Why? 
Insights can help:
Determine where there might be distance bias.
Schedule meetings more inclusively.
Maximize in-office overlap.
 
🤝 
Strengthen "Weak Ties"
Ask your manager for an introduction to someone outside your team. Cross-functional relationships drive creativity and innovation.
Want to level up and stay visible while virtual? Join the thousands who’ve built their Personal Virtual Exposure & Influence Plan. 
Join the waitlist
 for our next workshop to start building yours.
Small, consistent actions lead to big results.
Dedicate just 20 minutes daily to learning or practicing a new behavior—and watch your professional fitness grow.
Here’s to a successful year ahead!
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider

subject: Year 2025 has begun!
body:
Why DEI will continue - and more!
 
The Spectra Diversity and Inclusion Profile™ provides valuable DEI data in one, easy 10 minute assessment. 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Encouraging News for 2025
Although the 2024 election results may reshape work for those of us working in diversity, equity and inclusion, Spectra Diversity has some 
bright spots
 to share from our colleagues who are doing DEI work.
Effenus Henderson’s article on 
McDonalds and the Backbone of DEI
. He describes how DEI is a dynamic process that requires constant recalibration.
Paolo Guadiano’s article on putting the “I” in DEI first by identifying the 
direct, tangible benefits of inclusion
.
James Felton Keith’s of Inclusion Score Inc.’s article titled “
DEI Supports Capitalism: Inclusion As A Driver Of Profitability And Innovation
”
Amy Waninger of Lead at Any Level has this engaging article: “
5 Reasons Not to Focus on Inclusive Leadership in 2025
”. You’ll need to read this one to understand the title!
Tawana Bhagwat of Organization at its Best, wrote about 
Finding Your Calm in the Chaos.
Chris Jones of Spectra Diversity adds to the mix with encouragement to 
Wake Up and Stay Woke!
Let's Make a Difference Together
 Your participation is crucial in shaping a future where every individual feels valued and included. Share this opportunity with your team and network to amplify the impact of our collective efforts in fostering inclusive cultures.
Thank you for your commitment to making inclusivity a core part of your leadership journey. 
Schedule a Virtual Coffee with Chris Jones
 
 
Spectra Diversity is gathering data on employee perceptions held by employees of different faiths within organizations. It's encouraging to see various faiths coexisting in this 500-person organization.
 
What is the Spectra Assessment?
The 
Spectra Diversity Inclusion Assessment
™
 measures diversity, equity and inclusion in one, easy 10-minute assessment.  
Get the kind of statistically validated data that will help your team develop DEI strategies to build an inclusive workplace culture.
 
Schedule a Free Demo

info@SpectraDiversity.com

subject: eMP/Ariba Performance Issues
body:
Update on Resolution Efforts
We would like to provide you with an update regarding the performance issues affecting the connection between Fieldglass and eMP/Ariba, following the recent security enhancements.

The SAP development team has confirmed that a code optimization is being tested. This marks a positive advancement toward addressing the slowness and related errors we have been experiencing.

In collaboration with Johnson & Johnson and SAP, we remain optimistic that this update will help to resolve the issues at hand. We are diligently working to clear the backlog of 2024 PO’s that were impacted by the performance issues and will begin to work on 2025 PO’s as soon as possible.  

Please rest assured that this matter continues to be a top priority for us, particularly as we approach the end of the year.

Thank you for your ongoing support and understanding.

(JNJN, insite-agent-worker-749ccf9897-d4zjf,  z24121715290185111648087)

subject: eMP/Ariba Performance Issues
body:
Update on Resolution Efforts
We would like to provide you with an update regarding the performance issues affecting the connection between Fieldglass and eMP/Ariba, following the recent security enhancements.

The SAP development team has confirmed that a code optimization is being tested. This marks a positive advancement toward addressing the slowness and related errors we have been experiencing.

In collaboration with Johnson & Johnson and SAP, we remain optimistic that this update will help to resolve the issues at hand. We are diligently working to clear the backlog of 2024 PO’s that were impacted by the performance issues and will begin to work on 2025 PO’s as soon as possible.  

Please rest assured that this matter continues to be a top priority for us, particularly as we approach the end of the year.

Thank you for your ongoing support and understanding.

subject: How to keep the best of the best talent
body:
Do you want to keep top Q4 performers into 2025? There are three things you can do today to earn their loyalty.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
During peak season, some talent stands out as exceptional. If you want to let them know – and convert them to full-time employment – here are three things to do now.
Guarantee their work hours
Conduct performance reviews and let them know their work is appreciated.
Consider offering performance bonuses
And when you get a breather, schedule a call with us. We want to know what skills or experience made these workers outstanding in their roles and how we can best support you in 2025.
 
Give us feedback

subject: How to beat Q4 burnout
body:
Help your workforce stay motivated during what can be a stressful lead up to the holidays. Read more about How to Succeed in Peak Season.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
Here’s the No. 1 reason workers leave jobs: “I felt like I wasn’t appreciated/treated fairly.” That’s according to our 2024 Voice of the American Workforce report.
During peak season, you need trained talent to stay. Here are some easy ideas to help keep them motivated, engaged, and feeling appreciated.
Keep breakroom stocked with complimentary packets to make hot drinks
Clean common areas regularly and make sure everything in those areas working properly
Greet workers by name and thank them for their efforts
Hold random drawings during each shift for company swag or gift cards
Staff up to accommodate requests for PTO during the holiday season
Arrange a holiday meal or potluck gathering for talent who work on Thanksgiving, Black Friday, or Cyber Monday
If you want more info about what attracts workers to jobs – or why they leave – we can help with industry-specific data. Or contact us to tell us about your hiring needs.
Find out more
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097

subject: {Q4} Got a staffing backup plan?
body:
Be prepared for staffing surprises in Q4 peak season. Make sure your account with Employbridge is up-to-date or contact us to set one up.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
Do you have a backup plan for Q4 staffing surprises? Or even a backup plan to your backup plan?
Take steps today to make sure you’re ready when staffing shortages occur. Contact us today to tell us about your most in-demand roles and make sure your account is current.
Don’t have an established account? No worries. We can set one up quickly and tell you about ready-to-work talent in your area. 
 
Talk with us
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097

subject: Are you staffed for Black Friday and beyond?
body:
Take some of the stress out of the year’s biggest shopping weekend by showing workers how much you appreciate them. Get ideas from Employbridge.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
Things can get stressful during peak season, so here’s a reminder to show your Q4 talent some extra appreciation for the long days they put in. 
 
Hot doughnuts and coffee, deli platters, and even gift cards can make workers feel appreciated. That really matters in your field. In fact, “I felt like I wasn’t appreciated/treated fairly” was the top reason logistics workers gave for leaving their last job, according to our 2024 Voice of the American Workforce report.
 
“Feeling overworked/burned out” wasn’t far behind, coming in as the No. 4 answer on our survey. We can help with that one too by meeting your unexpected talent needs during Q4 and beyond.
Let's chat
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097
Employbridge © 2024. All rights reserved.

subject: {Logistics} Need more workers? We're ready to help.
body:
Are things going well? Do you need support ramping up for Q4? It’s not too late to partner with Employbridge for solutions.
 
Hey there Daniel, 
 
before things get even more busier, we wanted to see how peak season is shaping up for you.
 
We hope things are going great, and that our How to Succeed in Peak Season tips are helping.
 
Of course, we’re ready to do more. We can provide last-minute staffing support if you discover you need to boost your workforce or add talent to cover for absences and PTO.
 
Let’s partner for a successful peak season.
Get in touch

subject: How bonuses can attract and retain peak season talent
body:
Sign on and completion bonuses, gift cards for attendance … there are many ways to attract, motivate, and retain Q4 talent. Read more about How to Succeed in Peak Season.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
We know that bonuses work for attracting, motivating, and retaining talent through peak season. That makes sense – we all like a little extra money, right?
 
Of course, there are many ways to offer bonuses. By being creative, you can stand out in a competitive hiring environment, boost attendance, and improve retention.
 
Here are a few ways to offer bonuses that have worked for Employbridge clients:
As a sign-on incentive
For completing the season
At the season’s midpoint and end
For recruiting friends and family members
To recognize teams that hit stretch goals
As gift cards to improve attendance and efficiency 
Need other ideas? 
Read our quick blog article on the topic
. With more than 30+ years in staffing, Employbridge has the experience with bonuses and other programs to help you succeed in peak season.
 
Let's connect
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097
Employbridge © 2024. All rights reserved.
Unsubscribe

subject: ➡️ Do This Instead of Being Busy
body:
Doors are closing
 
 
Hi Dan,
 
The worst thing you can do for your career when working in a hybrid, distributed or remote work environment?
 
Just doing the work. Neglecting building your exposure.
 
Getting impacted by distance bias and recency bias.
 
Limited visibility.
Limited networking.
Limited influence.
 
To advance your career faster and build your influence, you need to prioritize building your exposure. ↓
 
Got 5 minutes to increase visibility?
↳ Share a recent team success in your team chat.
↳ Add a valuable comment on a colleague’s post.
↳ Send a quick thank you email to a cross-functional partner.
 
Got 15 minutes to build your network?
↳ Offer to help a new colleague with a task.
↳ Find out how to join an employee resource group.
 
Got 90 minutes to create a personalized and actionable plan?
 
↳ Sign up now to join me on 
November 12th
 or 
November 13th
 and I will walk you through my 5-step process.
 
↳ You will leave the workshop with a fully flushed out plan to build your exposure, network and influence across different locations, time zones, and hybrid schedules.
 
↳ You will be equipped to hack distance bias & recency bias to stay visible and achieve your career and business goals.
 
I developed my “Build Your Network & Influence Across Distance” workshop through years of practical application combined with the latest research on distributed team and remote work best practices.
 
Focus on being visible instead of just being busy.
Ticket sales are ending.
This is your last chance to get your ticket for this 90-minute small group workshop:
Build Your Network & Influence Across Distance
I'm not sure when I'll be offering this again as an open enrollment opportunity.
Choose from these sessions:
November 12th:
 
8am - 9:30am PST  /  11am - 12:30pm EST
↳ 
ticket sales end at 6pm EST today
 
November 13th:
2:30pm - 2pm PST  /  3:30pm - 5pm EST
↳ 
ticket sales end at 6pm EST tomorrow
Start 2025 with a clear plan.
A plan to boost your exposure, stay visible, and increase your influence—no matter where you work.
I look forward to seeing you there!
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
P.S. Don’t lose out on using your 2024 professional development funds. Most employers offer reimbursement for training workshops! 😉
P.P.S. Join the thousands of others that have attended this workshop over the past 6 years and have put their plans into action.

New from McKinsey & Company 
Leadership lessons from veterans﻿
Why are veterans so valuable to the workforce? Gain deeper insights into the unique skillsets they bring to the table. Revisit a conversation between McKinsey’s
 
Aaron De Smet
 
and Adria Horn, an army veteran and Tilson executive, on the
 
unexpected similarities between reintegrating into civilian life after deployment and navigating the workplace
 
after crisis. And watch senior partner
 
Scott Blackburn
’s 
interview with Nate Boaz, Marine Corps veteran and Microsoft executive, whose
 
leadership and passion for helping others
 
continued in postmilitary life. Then explore more insights to learn about the many contributions veterans make in leadership positions and across all levels of the workforce.
Read more﻿
A military veteran knows why your employees are leaving
She also knows what you can—and can’t—do about it. Here are three surprising lessons from a veteran of the wars in Iraq and Afghanistan.
See the conversation 
Author Talks: Fighting the good fight
Are you built to face your greatest fears head-on? Marine Corps veteran and Microsoft executive Nate Boaz shares ways to develop the courage to get through the most trying times—and come out on top.
Be full-hearted
 
From the military to the workforce: How to leverage veterans’ skills
Traditional ways of hiring make it harder for many service members to land civilian jobs. A new approach could help veterans transition to the workforce—and add $15 billion to the US economy.
A new approach 
Leading a transformation in the Department of Veterans Affairs
The assistant secretary for enterprise integration at the US Department of Veterans Affairs discusses the agency’s ongoing transformation and how it’s benefiting the veterans it serves.
Read more
 
MORE FROM MCKINSEY
McKinsey on Veterans﻿
Since our founding in 1926 by World War I US Army veteran James O. McKinsey, our firm has remained committed to and proud of serving military and veteran communities. We live this commitment in our work, serving those who serve others.﻿
Read more
 
Veterans’ untapped earning potential
US military veterans may be missing out on potential earnings after active duty.

.

subject: 🟣 First Time Sharing This Publicly…
body:
Limited spots available
 
 
Hi Dan,
 
Have you ever felt like the person that got chosen for a new role or a promotion was the person that was closest in proximity to the decision maker?
  
Have you seen how a select few of your peers always stay top of mind when it comes to getting the resources they need or getting invited to work on the best projects? 
  
It can feel unfair when you work so hard for something and then seem to be left out.
  
It can feel discouraging when your projects get slowed down or changed because your senior leader didn't think of asking you for input on a decision that would impact your team.
It can feel frustrating to miss out on opportunities because you were not the first person your key stakeholder thought of when building their team.
 
  
A significant differentiating factor between those who stay top of mind and get what they need and those who don’t is how they…
  
Stay visible and influence others across distance
 🌎
  
Nobody wants to feel left out, but… 
  
Everybody wants to progress in their career and achieve their goals. 
  
The problem is that most of us work in a geographically distributed, hybrid, or remote work environment where we don’t see our leaders and peers in the same office every single day. 
  
Nobody taught us that Distance Bias and Recency Bias could impact our ability to influence our key stakeholders and stay visible from behind a screen miles away. 
  
That’s why I created 
a simplified and organized five-step process
 to help you build your influence and exposure, no matter where you work. 
  
This process was previously only shared with companies that contracted with me to train their teams.
  
And for the first time, I’m sharing it with the public so that you get direct access to building these skills.
  
No matter where you are in your career, with the tools, tactics, and strategies taught in the 
Build Your Network and Influence Across Distance Workshop
, you’ll be equipped to create an actionable plan that’ll allow you to… 
  
✅ Hack Distance bias and Recency bias so that you and your ideas are seen as valuable no matter where you work from
  
✅ Build your exposure up, down, and across your organization 
  
✅ Better influence your internal stakeholders and external customers
  
✅ Go from being more transactional with your team and stakeholders to building deeper relationships
 
✅ Expand your network to find the right people that can impact your career growth
  
✅ Become more effective in how you use synchronous and asynchronous communication to influence across distance
  
These 
small group workshops
 on November 12th and 13th still have a handful of spots available. 
  
So, if you need to stay top of mind and visible as you work across different locations, time zones, and hybrid schedules,
 
Then 
I encourage you to join us.
  
I won’t open any more slots, so make sure to sign up now to reserve your spot.
November 12th: 8-9:30am PST / 11-12:30pm EST 
November 13th: 12:30-2pm PST / 3:30-5pm EST
  
I look forward to seeing you there! 
  
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
 
PS. Are you not sure who you need to influence? In this workshop, I’ll help you map out your sphere of influence to pinpoint the stakeholders and leaders you should influence and how. 
  
This eye-opening exercise has dramatically impacted the results of my students after learning that there are quite a few people they NEED to influence who they haven’t even thought about.

subject: Maybe it's time to be more flexible?
body:
It’s not too late to take a hard look at hiring policies and assessments for contingent talent. Read more about How to Succeed in Peak Season.
 
Hello Daniel, 
 
Take it from us – we know how important policies and assessments are to the hiring process. However, there are times when it makes sense to adopt a “less is more” approach.
 
Like during peak season.
Employers need to ask themselves:
Is our screening criteria set up for today’s unemployment rate?
Do we require unnecessary testing of temporary employees before assignment?
Do we require a non-standard background check or vendor?
Do we have a GED or high school completion criteria, and is it relevant for all jobs in our facility?
Is our re-hire process too stringent? Have we considered instituting a second-chance program?
Want to be sure you can compete for talent? The Employbridge team can help.
Get in touch
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097
Employbridge © 2024. All rights reserved.

subject: BCG Like Research Services for Alums
body:
Dear Daniel
,
 
Hope you and your family are safe and doing well; it is good to connect with you as a BCG alum!
I am reaching out to you as part of Slidexpress Knowledge & Insights, where we are working with a number of BCG alumni helping them with their research and analytics requirements, in a manner similar to the research division at the firm. We started out as a group of ex Management consultants from McKinsey and BCG offering presentation services and as a natural extension to that, have now expanded our offerings to include ‘Knowledge & Insights’ services within the BCG community. 
 
Most alumni struggle with research-related tasks in their day-to-day functions and end up spending a fair bit of non-value-adding time on this. To address this, we have set up a dedicated team of research and knowledge analysts comprised of ex-BCG professionals who understand the "BCG way of problem-solving". 
 
The offering is specially tailored to BCG alumni (currently working with more than 400+ clients across the globe) and includes:
- Market intelligence and insights
- Strategic business research across industries
- Overnight custom research, tailored to your needs
- Data extraction and analytics
Our pricing is very competitive at $20-40 per hour for ad-hoc research tasks and a fixed fee for support across scoped projects. Do let us know if this is of interest and we can share further details about our solution offering.
 
Thanks and Regards,
Vishesh
Knowledge & Insights at SlideXpress
| 
vishesh.matreja@mecstudio.com
DISCLAIMER: 
This email is intended for informational purposes only and should not be construed as a solicitation. Your contact information has been assembled using a combination of various third-party contact databases such as ZoomInfo, RocketReach, LinkedIn Sales Navigator, etc. and has not been taken from the McKinsey Alumni Center. If you do not wish to be contacted in the future, please notify us immediately by return email and destroy the original message.

subject: The Hardest Skill To Learn ➡️
body:
When working across locations
 
 
Hi Dan,
When I relocated from San Francisco to Philadelphia, over 3,000 miles from my team at The Clorox Company, I quickly realized that working across distance came with unique challenges.
No more casual in-office chats in the hallway or at the water cooler.
No more attending meetings in-person.
It was easy to be left out or forgotten.
I became aware of how I could be impacted by Distance Bias and Recency Bias.
I worried about missing out on key opportunities simply because I wasn’t physically in front of my key stakeholders and senior leaders on a regular cadence.
I worried that at a distance I was not going to be able to maintain my influence when it came to getting the approvals and resources I needed for our team to hit our business objectives.
I knew I needed 
a way to stay visible and build my network and my influence
, regardless of location.
 
I needed to approach this problem strategically and intentionally.
So, through years of practical application, and combining that with the latest research on network analysis and distributed team communication best practices, 
I developed a streamlined five-step process for building your virtual influence and exposure. 
 
I have already provided this workshop to thousands of people, with stellar results.
And on November 12th and 13th, I’ll guide small groups through this step-by-step process. 
By the end of the 90-minute session, you’ll have created your own Personal Virtual Exposure and Influence Plan plan to put into action right away.
You will be equipped to build your network and hack distance bias as you work across different locations, time zones, and hybrid schedules.
Ready to master virtual influence and stay visible in a geographically distributed, hybrid or remote work setting? 
Click here to learn more and register for the workshop.
I look forward to seeing you there!
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
P.S. Consider using your 2024 professional development funds from your company to cover the cost. Most employers offer reimbursement for training workshops! 😉

subject: The Hardest Skill I Learned ➡️
body:
While leading teams from distance
 
 
Hi Dan,
When I relocated from San Francisco to Philadelphia, over 3,000 miles from my team at The Clorox Company, I quickly realized that working across distance came with unique challenges.
No more casual in-office chats in the hallway or at the water cooler.
No more attending meetings in-person.
It was easy to be left out or forgotten.
I became aware of how I could be impacted by Distance Bias and Recency Bias.
I worried about missing out on key opportunities simply because I wasn’t physically in front of my key stakeholders and senior leaders on a regular cadence.
I worried that at a distance I was not going to be able to maintain my influence when it came to getting the approvals and resources I needed for our team to hit our business objectives.
I knew I needed 
a way to stay visible and build my network and my influence
, regardless of location.

So, through years of practical application, and combining that with the latest research on network analysis and distributed team communication best practices,

Get ready for the weekend
—and the start of a new month—by diving into the week’s big insights on team effectiveness, the impact of Hurricanes Helene and Milton, Daniel Kahneman, and more.
 
﻿What makes a team effective? 
Aaron De Smet
, 
Gemma D’Auria
, and coauthors debunk common myths about how teams operate and examine the elements of team effectiveness that have the biggest impact on performance.
The road to better team effectiveness﻿
 
Adi Kumar
, 
Alberto Chaia
, 
Olivia White
, and Kanmani Chockalingam explore the impact of two recent US hurricanes on small businesses.
﻿Learn more
 
﻿Tim Koller
﻿
 shares how a conversation with psychologist Daniel Kahneman changed his perspective on value creation.
﻿Some good news
 
﻿The world of marketing is becoming more expansive and complicated. 
Jessica Moulton
, 
Pavlos Exarchos
, 
Stefan Rickert
, 
Tjark Freundt
, 
Warren Teichner
, and coauthors explore the biggest challenges CMOs face in defining, steering, and producing the growth agenda.
﻿4 pillars of excellence
Ready to unwind?
Author Talks: Why ‘really’ putting your people first pays off
Struggling with employee retention? A business school professor explains why treating employees like customers is crucial to improving the employee experience—and your bottom line.
Read exclusively on the McKinsey Insights app
 
What is net zero?
Net zero is an ideal state where the amount of greenhouse gases released into the Earth’s atmosphere is equal to the amount removed. Emission removal and reduction through decarbonization efforts are needed to reach net zero.

Explainer

subject: 60% of Career Success is because of this ➡️
body:
And it’s not what you think…
 
 
Hi Dan,
Did you know that it is estimated that only 10% of career success is because of performance? 
  
This is a tiny percentage, yet people focus most of their energy on this.
  
In a way, it makes sense. 
  
You would think that the better you perform at work, the faster you would progress in your career. 
And sure, it’s essential to keep improving your skills and performance, but here’s what you need to focus on to make a bigger difference. 
 
Exposure.
  
According to Harvey Coleman’s P.I.E. Theory of Success, approximately 60% of career success is due to exposure. 
  
And when I say exposure, I mean who knows about you and what you do. 
  
Just think about that for a second.
  
It could be that sixty percent of your career success is dependent on being visible.
  
Having good exposure means that…
  
✅ Key leaders, peers, and stakeholders know about you 
✅ They understand your reputation and what you do
✅ They have built a relationship with you 
✅ They know exactly how you can add value
  
Building your exposure is a hard skill to master. 
Most of us have never been taught how to approach it.
  
And when busy and buried in tasks, it’s hard to find the time to consider how to increase your visibility and build your network. 
 
And doing this across distance is even harder.
  
When you work in a geographically distributed, hybrid, or remote organization and don’t see your key stakeholders in the office every day
  
...Distance Bias can take effect and it’s possible that you won’t be considered because you are not top of mind. 
  
And there’s a good chance you need to expand your exposure to more people than you think, and across many different locations, to meet your business goals and achieve your career aspirations.
  
From my 14 years of experience leading and influencing within hybrid and remote organizations, I want to make it easier for you to increase your exposure 
  
…so that you can always stay top of mind when your key leader or stakeholder is thinking about who they want to mentor, promote or assign to a new project. 
 
…so that you have established a network - across locations & time zones -  that enables you to influence business outcomes.  
In November, I’ll share exactly how to increase your visibility and exposure so you can do just this. 
In the 
Build Your Network & Influence Across Distance Workshop
, I’ll reveal my five-step process for developing your personalized plan to increase your exposure and influence.
 
 
This framework will equip you with everything you need to know to take your visibility to the next level. 
  
When you 
increase your exposure
, you put yourself on a faster track to career growth.
  
If this sounds like something you could use, I invite you to join us. 
  
Choose which day works best for you… either November 12th or the 13th, I’ll be leading a 90 minute, small-group workshop.
  
At the end of the workshop, you’ll have a tangible understanding and an actionable plan to increase your exposure immediately 
  
… so that you never get overlooked or under-recognized. 
  
So whether you are working from home, have a hybrid schedule, or are working with teams across time zones…
  
This workshop will help you build the skill set you need to stay top of mind in your organization.  
  
Limited spaces are available, so make sure to claim your spot early. 
  
I look forward to seeing you there! 
  
Sacha Connor
CEO, Virtual Work Insider
  
PS. I have taught this workshop to thousands of people. And now this is my first time offering it in a way that you can choose to enroll directly! Usually your company would have had to hire me as a trainer in order for you to learn these skills, strategies, and tactics.

subject: {Register} EY + EB Webinar: Workforce Trends & Insights for the Future
body:
Tune in for an upcoming webinar to hear about workforce trends. Hosted by EY and Employbridge.
 
Hello Daniel, 
As the labor market normalizes and innovations emerge, how should you respond to gain a talent advantage?
 
Find out in a 60-minute webinar hosted by EY and Employbridge. Our expert panel will review new EY research on workforce trends, share insights on how it might impact your business, and offer ideas on what you can do to stay ahead.
 
Panelists include:
Cathi Canfield, Employbridge VP of Talent Development
Liz Fealy, EY Global Organization & People Private Equity Leader and People Advisory Services Tax Deputy
 
Moderated by Bill Ravenscroft, Employbridge Chief Revenue Officer 
 
11 a.m. – 12 p.m. EST
November 12, 2024 
Online 
Save your spot
 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097
Employbridge © 2024. All rights reserved.

, global leader of industries, & 
Axel Karlsson
, global leader of functional practices and growth platforms
Welcome to the latest edition of 
The Weekend Read
. We hope you find our perspectives useful. Let us know what you think at 
Alex_Panas@McKinsey.com
 and 
Axel_Karlsson@McKinsey.com
.
—Alex and Axel
﻿Get cozy this weekend
 and fall into the week’s highlights on this year’s Global Banking Annual Review, data centers in real estate, rewiring for the era of gen AI, and more.
 
Asheet Mehta
, 
Klaus Dallerup
,
 Luca Pancaldi
, 
Miklós Dietz
, 
Pradip Patiath
, 
Vik Sohoni
, and coauthors explain how the “management quotient” will be a differentiator for banks in the remaining years of the 2020s.
﻿Where to compete
 
﻿The demand for data centers is growing. Senior partner Pankaj Sachdeva explores how real estate companies can participate in the growth of this industry.
﻿Opportunities in data centers
 
While there is a lot of excitement around generative AI, realizing its value can be hard. Senior partners 
R
odney Zemmel
, 
Eric Lamarre
, and 
Kate Smaje
 discuss how leaders can deliver successful digital and AI transformations in a fast-changing era.
﻿A play-by-play guide
 
﻿By providing more innovative products and achieving go-to-market excellence, the US employer health benefits market can compete more effectively to meet employers’ and members’ evolving needs, write 
Akshay Kapur
, 
Monisha Machado-Pereira
, and coauthors.
﻿See alternatives
Ready to unwind?
Value creation priorities shaping medtech
With pandemic-related volatility subsiding, the strategies separating industry leaders from their peers are coming into focus.
Shape and reshape
 
Global Farmer Insights 2024
Farmers are increasingly prioritizing productivity. A shift toward operations-focused solutions underscores a broader trend in agriculture, where efficiency and sustainability are becoming paramount.
See the insights
 
﻿58-Across: Be domineering toward (and a hint to this puzzle’s theme)
Know the answer? Test yourself with the latest McKinsey Crossword: Executive Order | No. 202
Lead by example
 
﻿
—Edited by Joyce Yoo, editor, New York

subject: Insights on CEO Succession, Transformation Offices, and Strategy-Driven Organization Design
body:
Gain valuable perspectives on CEO candidate strategies, innovative transformation approaches, and the essential role of corporate strategy in organization design.
 
 
Risks and Rewards of Internal and External CEO Candidates
CEO succession is a critical decision, requiring a careful balance between internal candidates who offer continuity and external candidates who can drive transformation.
Read More
 
 
The Next Frontier of Transformation
Traditional project management offices are insufficient for today’s complex transformations. A transformation office with a "mission control" function that combines project management, decision support, change management, and executive guidance is needed.
Read More
 
 
Keeping Your Corporate Strategy at the Center of Your Organization Design
The most effective organization designs are tailored to the company’s strategic goals and capabilities rather than relying on "blunt instruments" to enhance agility and value delivery.
Read More
 
Did You Hear the News?
Lotis Blue is now part of SCH Capital Holdings, Inc. This strategic partnership marks a significant milestone in our journey, reinforcing our commitment to delivering best-in-class consulting services and driving greater value for our clients.
Read More
 
 
Lotis Blue Consulting, 200 West Adams Street, Suite 2900, Chicago, Illinois 60606, United States

body:
