subject: New (QuickFire) Challenge, new opportunities
body:
Gearing up for the next phase of growth
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page
 
here
.
Dear Dan,
As we enter the fourth quarter of the year, we reflect on the exciting milestones that have brought us here, including our celebration of the four-year anniversary of BLUE KNIGHT™ in August. During this celebration, we released a 
virtual scrapbook
 filled with memories and milestones from the past four years, along with heartfelt quotes from our team, collaborators, and 
Blue Knight
 companies. These reflections showcase the incredible journey and growth of the initiative, as well as the strong community we have built together.
While we may be approaching the year’s end, we are far from slowing down. We recently announced the next 
Blue Knight
 Resident QuickFire Challenge
, and similar to past challenges, we are excited to incorporate a partner track. We are eager to hear from non-
Blue Knight
 companies who may be interested in collaborating with 
Blue Knight
 companies on a partner track application. To help facilitate these potential partnerships, we encourage non-
Blue Knight
 early-stage companies to complete a 
short form
 with their company information and partnership goals. Through the partner track, the goal is for early-stage companies to work together to accelerate both companies and reach critical inflection points to reach patients more rapidly. The partner track aims to help early-stage companies collaborate, accelerate the growth of both companies, and reach critical milestones to bring their innovations to patients faster.
We are excited for what lies ahead and remain committed to unleashing the power of science and technology to advance health security. Keep reading for more updates from 
Blue Knight
 companies as they continue to make strides in bringing disruptive innovations to life. 
Rachel Rath
 
Director, BARDA Alliance, Johnson & Johnson Innovation – JLABS

subject: Wefunder
body:

Final chance to invest in Lively Root. Limited shares are available.  
To invest: 
https://wefunder.com/livelyroot
Cheers, 
Colin Barceloux 
CEO, Lively Root 
2869 Historic Decatur Road 
San Diego CA 92106

 to no longer receive emails from us.

Would you be interested in joining our crowdfunding raise?

Our customers are always raving about how helpful, kind, and thoughtful our CX team is, and we couldn't agree more.
Get to know our small but mighty Customer Experience team and what they’re gifting this season!
“At Goody, our entire team is super passionate about quality items that are timeless. When we’re curating our catalog we focus on items that can last for years and become favorites. Here are some of mine that are meaningful gifts and fit this vibe right now.”
Read Now
 
“We have so many awesome brands to offer, but my go to gift is 
The Tushy
. It is not usually something you think you need or may buy for yourself, but then when you have one you’ll never want to live without it!”
Gift Now
 
“I love the pieces from Mejuri, but am obsessed with 
these chunky hoops
 and their versatility.”
Gift Now
 
“Love gifting 
The Comfy
 to all my friends and family who work from home!  Love that it's a wearable blanket keeping you warm and cozy during your WFH calls.”
Gift Now
 
“
Polaroid Go Gen 2 Everything Box
 is the perfect interactive gift that one can use to capture moments from your event, the current season and for years to come!”
Gift Now

﻿What are your weekend plans? 
Take a moment to relax and catch up on the week’s big insights on America’s small businesses, the airline retailing opportunity, the economic potential of EVs in Europe, and more.﻿
 
Micro-, small, and medium-size enterprises (MSMEs) are the bedrock of the US economy. Strengthening networks and collaboration with large companies could help US MSMEs gain advantages of scale in technology, human capital, market access, and finance, write 
Olivia White
, 
Anu Madgavkar
, 
Adi Kumar
, 
Asutosh Padhi
, and Kanmani Chockalingam.﻿
﻿Reach the next level of growth
 
How can airlines get started on their retailing journeys and avoid getting left behind by quicker-moving peers? 
Matteo Pacca
, 
Vik Krishnan
, and coauthors discuss the bold actions airlines can take to catalyze a modern retailing approach.﻿
﻿Take flight
 
Europe has long been a pivotal force in the global automotive industry. 
Andreas Tschiesner
, 
Ruth Heuss
, and coauthors explore how the industry can thrive in an increasingly electric world.﻿
﻿A way forward
 
﻿What are nurses’ perspectives on AI in healthcare delivery? 
Gretchen Berlin, RN
 and coauthors unpack the findings of a national survey jointly deployed by McKinsey and the American Nurses Foundation.
﻿Understand nurses’ perspectives
Ready to unwind?
﻿A tech titan, a literacy leader, and a cookie magnate
Our September obituaries also include a legal trailblazer, an innovative ophthalmologist, and a publishing pioneer who forged a path for women authors.
Check out the September obituaries
 
Fortune or fiction? The real value of a digital and AI transformation in CPG
A new McKinsey analysis quantifies the impact that digital and AI can have on consumer goods businesses and where consumer-packaged-goods executives should focus their efforts.
Create long-term value
 
33-Down: Migration up a river
Know the answer? Test yourself with the latest McKinsey Crossword: Skipping School | No. 200
Pass with flying colors
 
﻿
—Edited by Joyce Yoo, editor, New York

subject: Top 10 reports this quarter
body:
At #1: The hard stuff: Navigating the physical realities of the energy transition  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

McKinsey Explainers

Top Ten Reports │ Third Quarter 2024
Our top ten reports this quarter look at women in the workplace, climate change, asset management, and more. At No. 1, McKinsey's 
Humayun Tai
, 
Sven Smit
, and coauthors 
explore
 the physical realities of the energy transition.
1. The hard stuff: Navigating the physical realities of the energy transition
The energy transition is a physical transformation in its early stages. What challenges lie ahead?
 
Forge a path
 
 
2. Women in the Workplace 2024: The 10th-anniversary report
In the tenth year of our Women in the Workplace research, in partnership with LeanIn.Org, we reflect on the notable gains women have made—and how their experiences at work are, in many ways, the same or worse than ten years ago. Sustainable progress toward parity requires that companies recommit to change.
 
Recommendations for companies
 
3. Global Energy Perspective 2024
As the global energy transition enters a new phase, our Global Energy Perspective 2024 presents a data-driven view of the possible road ahead.
 
See the report
 
 
4. 
Retailers’ climate road map: Charting paths to decarbonized value chains
Most emissions captured in the average retailer’s Scope 3 metric are generated via product value chains. These value chains can be decarbonized—but only with targeted multistakeholder actions.
 
Seize the opportunity
 
5. 
Global Materials Perspective 2024
As the energy transition continues apace, the global materials supply is adapting. Our Global Materials Perspective 2024 presents a data-driven view of the road ahead.
 
See what's ahead
 
6. 
Aiming higher: Embedding ‘systematic ambition’ to drive UK corporate growth
A new perspective shows how the UK corporate landscape is evolving and how top performers within it create the conditions necessary to achieve their ambitions.
 
Get the bigger picture
 
7. 
The Iberian green industrial opportunity: Seizing the moment
Possessing natural endowments and mature industrial infrastructure, Spain and Portugal have an unprecedented opportunity to lead the energy transition and create significant value for the region.
 
Getting back on track
 
8. 
Evolving with steel: Future growth and opportunities
Steel is a core material for building infrastructure and aiding economic growth. Over the next decade and beyond, several trends will reshape the global and regional steel industry landscape.
 
Stronger with steel
 
9. 
Nature stress test: Assessing exposure of five African banking systems
Nature-related risks are impacting Africa’s natural ecosystems and economy. An enabling environment could accelerate action from Africa’s private financial sector to manage risks and opportunities.
 
Assess risks and opportunities
 
10. 
Beyond the balance sheet: North American asset management 2024
Even with markets in ascent, asset managers’ revenues have flatlined. But the evolution of balance sheets among banks, insurers, and high-net-worth individuals could unlock the next wave of growth.
 
6 themes

New from McKinsey & Company 
McKinsey in global media: Productivity, generative AI, and more
Did you know that McKinsey authors offer their perspectives in global media on a regular basis? Since 2021, leading global business and industry newspapers, magazines, and industry publications have published more than 200 articles by McKinsey authors. These range from an 
op-ed in 
The Wall Street Journal

Bob Sternfels

New from McKinsey & Company
﻿The State of Black Residents: Place, Racial Equity, and Transformative Solutions
Understanding the lived experiences of Black residents in America is crucial for fostering equitable communities. In our 2021 report, 
The Economic State of Black America
, we looked at the barriers and opportunities Black Americans face in the economy. Building on this, we now turn our focus to the Black resident experience, revealing significant disparities in quality-of-life metrics across communities (e.g., standard of living, job opportunities, secure housing, and more).
Despite some progress, there remains no place in the United States where 
Black residents experience
 outcomes equal to their White neighbors. Even in America’s suburbs and exurbs, where the balance of positive outcomes is relatively better, large disparities persist.
Join 
Shelley Stewart
 and 
JP Julien
 on Tuesday, October 1st at 9:30 a.m. EDT / 3:30 p.m. CET as they discuss the nuanced landscape of racial disparities and share examples of transformative solutions that can drive meaningful change for Black residents and their communities.
﻿Register now

subject: The quarter’s top themes
body:
At #1: The executive's reading list ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

STILL INTERESTED?
We hope you enjoy hearing from us and want to continue getting the emails you’ve signed up for. Let us know.
Yes, I'm still interested
For direct answers to complex questions, check out 
McKinsey Explainers
.
Top Ten McKinsey Themes │ Third Quarter 2024
In the third quarter of 2024, our top ten posts from 
McKinsey Themes
 highlight 
middle managers, saying ‘no’ at work, top technology trends, and more
. At No. 1 is 
The executive’s reading list
, which features books recommended by global leaders—like McKinsey’s 
Bob Sternfels
—to consider adding to your library. Read on for our full top 10.
1. The executive’s reading list﻿
Reading isn’t just for leisure; it’s a power move for leaders. Books can boost smarts, enhance emotional intelligence, and even help keep stress in check. Are you looking to hone your leadership skills?
 
Read to lead
 
 
2. What to read next: books on AI
Literature on artificial intelligence (AI) is everywhere, and for good reason. McKinsey research estimates that generative AI could add between $2.6 trillion to $4.4 trillion annually to the economy while increasing the impact of all AI by 15 to 40 percent.
 
Learn about the hot topic
 
3. Help yourself to these personal development books
You don’t need to wait for the new year to make positive changes in your life—you can start right now. Whether you’re taking steps to define your purpose, tackling big projects, or trying to curb overthinking, these personal development books just might give you the motivation you need to get started.
 
Make resolutions now
 
 
4. 
What are McKinsey leaders reading?
Leaders who engage in well-rounded reading across genres expose themselves to diverse ideas and management examples. Books can encourage reflective thinking, enhance a perspective, or equip leaders with new tools to lead their teams effectively.
 
Explore these 6 titles
 
5. 
Top 15 technology trends unfolding today
Generative AI (gen AI) has rightly seized leaders’ attention in recent years. But is it also eclipsing adjacent or lower-profile digital imperatives?
 
Generative AI and more
 
6. 
It’s time to rethink the role of the middle manager
Managers are crucial to a company’s success. McKinsey analysis shows that organizations with top-performing managers yield multiple times the total shareholder returns of those with average or below-average managers over a period of five years.
 
Your most precious resource
 
7. 
The six parts to a superpower
What do companies comprising the Magnificent Seven and the Granolas have in common? They have captured investors’ fancy with a superpower, or an integrated set of people, processes, and technology that creates value by helping an organization do something better than its competitors.
 
Fly above competitors
 
8. 
What does the future hold for India?
As India anticipates a century of independence in 2047, it is committing to sustainable and inclusive growth in its goal of becoming a developed economy. To understand how Indian enterprises can achieve the growth necessary to help propel the nation towards its centennial aspirations, McKinsey analyzed publicly traded companies over a 10-year period.
 
7 trends
 
9. 
How to say ‘no’ at work
Disagreeing at work about critical business problems can be constructive if done in a healthy manner. That’s according to McKinsey’s Chris Hartley and coauthors: “Contributory dissent allows individuals and groups to air their differences in a way that moves the discussion toward a positive outcome and doesn’t undermine leadership or group cohesion.”
 
Flex your ‘no muscle’
 
10. 
The energy transition: Where are we, really?
Make no mistake—a lot of progress has been made on the energy transition since the landmark 2015 Paris Agreement.
 
3 major issues 
 
Follow our thinking
 
Share these insights

subject: Latinos in Hollywood: 5 percent is not enough
body:
4 actions for industry leadership ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

New from McKinsey & Company 
﻿Latinos in Hollywood: 5 percent is not enough
Latinos in the United States are avid consumers of the film and TV industry, accounting for a high percentage of box office ticket sales and streaming subscriptions. Yet, they hold less than 5 percent of leading on-screen, off-screen, and executive leadership roles in Hollywood. 
Improving representation of Latinos in narratives and media boardrooms could generate billions of dollars in new revenue, 
say
 McKinsey’s 
Lucy Pérez
, 
Tomás Lajous
, and coauthors. See how Hollywood and media can better amplify Latino voices, then explore other insights in honor of National #HispanicHeritageMonth, which kicks off today in the US.﻿
﻿Read more
Latinos in Hollywood: Amplifying voices, expanding horizons
Improving on- and off-screen representation of Latinos, their stories, and their culture could generate billions of dollars in new revenue for the industry, according to new McKinsey research.
Close the gap 
The economic state of Latinos in America: Advancing financial growth
Financial-services revenues from Latinos may grow by more than $90 billion by 2030. To get more of that market, institutions would need to tailor their offerings.
Learn how to grow
 
What Black and Latino consumers want healthcare stakeholders to know
Understanding consumer behavior and attitude drivers may help stakeholders improve health outcomes and experiences for Black and Latino patients.
Understand diverse needs 
Mapping the road to prosperity and parity for Black and Latino residents across America
Black and Latino US residents experience different levels of prosperity and parity depending on where they live. Our interactive map explores this variation across all US counties.
Explore the data
 
Zooming in: Using local insights to inform US racial-equity efforts
Neighborhood-level data could help cities across the United States strategically craft interventions to effect real change for Black and Hispanic residents.
See the three-part approach
 
To see more essential reading on topics that matter, visit 
McKinsey Themes
.
— Edited by  Esther Chung, editor, Atlanta

subject: Top 10 insights this quarter
body:
At #1: McKinsey's 2024 annual book recommendations ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Yes, I'm still interested
For direct answers to complex questions, check out 
McKinsey Explainers
.
Top Ten Newsletter │ Third Quarter 2024
Our top ten insights this quarter look at digital transformations, the energy transition, employee motivation, and more. At No. 1 is "
What to read next: McKinsey’s 2024 annual book recommendations
," which features contributions from CEOs, founders, media leaders, and McKinsey leaders, including 
Bob Sternfels
, 
Kweilin Ellingrud
, and 
Homayoun Hatami
.
1. What to read next: McKinsey’s 2024 annual book recommendations
Looking for your next book? Each year, McKinsey seeks out the best books in business, technology, workplace culture, and more. Here’s our 2024 list, recommended by CEOs, founders, editors in chief, and other global leaders.
 
Explore 90-plus book recommendations
 
 
2. McKinsey technology trends outlook 2024
Which technology trends matter most for companies in 2024? New analysis by the McKinsey Technology Council highlights the adoption, development, and industry effects of advanced technologies.
 
15 trends
 
3. What is digital transformation?
Digital transformation is the rewiring of an organization, with the goal of creating value by continuously deploying tech at scale. A clear digital transformation strategy focused on specific domains and enabled by a set of specific capabilities is critical for organizations to not only compete but survive. Digital transformations are not a one-and-done project; most executives will be on this journey for the rest of their careers.
 
Get it right
 
 
4. 
Why agents are the next frontier of generative AI
By moving from information to action—think virtual coworkers able to complete complex workflows—the technology promises a new wave of productivity and innovation.
 
3 ways to ease automation
 
5. 
The hard stuff: Navigating the physical realities of the energy transition
The energy transition is a physical transformation in its early stages. What challenges lie ahead?
 
Forge a path
 
6. 
What does the future hold for India?
This may be India’s century. We look ahead at seven trends likely to shape the country for years to come—and help it achieve its development goals.
 
7 trends
 
7. 
What is Gen Z?
Generation Z refers to people born between 1996 and 2010. They’re the second-youngest generation, between millennials and Generation Alpha. Gen Z identity has been shaped by the digital age, climate anxiety, a shifting financial landscape, and COVID-19. They’re known as ‘digital natives’—the first generation to grow up with the internet.
 
Get to know them
 
8. 
What employees say matters most to motivate performance
A survey of over 1,000 employees creates a data-backed view of what motivates employees to perform.
 
See the results
 
9. 
Chief of staff: Anatomy of the role in eight charts
Helping top leaders fulfill their missions can accelerate advancement and open new career opportunities.
 
See the trends
 
10. 
Gen AI’s next inflection point: From employee experimentation to organizational transformation
As many employees adopt generative AI at work, companies struggle to follow suit. To capture value from current momentum, businesses must transform their processes, structures, and approach to talent.
 
Catch up
 
Follow our thinking
 
Share these insights

Walking down memory lane.
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page
 
here
.
As we celebrate the fourth anniversary of BLUE KNIGHT™, we reflect on a journey of 
growth and impact
 since its inception in 2020. 
Blue Knight
 has grown to support 47 companies, launched three 
Blue Knight
 Resident QuickFire Challenges, including one to accelerate development of new vaccine and therapeutic technologies through 
Project NextGen
 and hosted four Symposiums, uniting a global audience. You can learn more about the 
initiative's impact
 directly from 
Blue Knight
 leadership as they 
discuss the progress made and the exciting future ahead
.
Join us in commemorating this milestone and relive some of our favorite memories from the past four years.

subject: Webinar: Understanding Veterans
body:
Register now to secure your spot and mark your calendar for an enriching experience that promises to transform your leadership perspective.
 
The Spectra Diversity and Inclusion Profile™ provides valuable DEI data in one, easy 10 minute assessment. 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Upcoming Webinar: Understanding Veterans
Date:
 September 16, 12pm CT
Featured Speaker:
 James Johnson, MAJ GEN, USAF (ret)
Organization: 
3 Delta Perspectives
Join us in September for an enlightening session with Chris Jones, Spectra Diversity CEO and James Johnson, Retired Major General of the US Air Force.
Chris will explore Chapter 9 of her book 
Powering Inclusive Cultures: Why Measurement Matters
, addressing why veterans are a strategic competitive advantage in the workplace.
 
James will address:
Leveraging the Edge: the unique contributions veterans bring to the workplace
Telling the Story: correcting myths of veterans’ employability and Integration
Veteran Challenges: Military Recruitment to Post-service Life
Harnessing Comprehensive Strategies: driving effective veteran recruitment and retention
Don’t let this opportunity pass you by!
 
Register now
 to secure your free spot and mark your calendar for an enriching experience that promises to transform your leadership perspective.
 
Let's Make a Difference Together
 Your participation is crucial in shaping a future where every individual feels valued and included. Share this opportunity with your team and network to amplify the impact of our collective efforts in fostering inclusive cultures.
Thank you for your commitment to making inclusivity a core part of your leadership journey. We look forward to seeing you June 10th.
Register Today
 
Did you miss the last session?
If you haven't been able to join our journey towards fostering inclusive cultures this far, no worries! Explore the valuable insights we've shared by watching the 
webinar recordings
.
 
The state of Diversity. Equity and Inclusion today

.

subject: The Call for Proposals is now LIVE for the 2025 Justice for All Virtual Summit!
body:
Inspire others with your thought leadership or art at the 2025 Justice for All: The Power of Inclusion Virtual Summit, April 22-24, 2025.
 
The 2025 Justice for All Virtual Summit Call for Proposals is NOW OPEN!
 
Accepting Proposals until October 18, 2024
We are thrilled to announce that The Winters Group is now accepting 
session proposals
 and 
performance proposals
 for the upcoming 
virtual 
Justice for All Summit: The Power of Inclusion 2025, taking place April 22-24, 2025.
 
This is your opportunity to inspire meaningful dialogue and action supporting equity, justice, and inclusion through your thought leadership and art. We are seeking innovative and impactful 
presentations 
and 
performances
. Submit your proposal by October 18, 2024 to be considered. For more details on submission guidelines and criteria,
 
visit our proposal portal
. 
Our standard session length is 60-minutes and includes housekeeping and time for Q&A (should you allow questions). 
All performances are 5-minutes long.
 
This year’s theme, “The Power of Inclusion", will collectively explore how we create spaces where differences are not only recognized, but celebrated for their strengths and how we create cultures where everyone is seen, heard, and valued for their authentic selves while utilizing their power to create a more inclusive world for all. 
Submit a proposal
 
What is the Justice for All Summit?
 
The third annual Justice for All Summit, being held April 22-24, 2025, is the premier virtual conference to connect, get inspired, and learn innovative strategies for cultural transformation through diversity, equity, inclusion, and justice practices. 
Thank you to the sponsors of the Justice for All Summit:
 
Merck, Cushman & Wakefield, Town & Country Markets
 
Download our 
sponsor brochure
 or 
contact us
 for more information!
 
 
 
 
The Winters Group, 8116 South Tryon Street, Ste. B3-260, Charlotte, North Carolina 28273, United States 
Unsubscribe

subject: Introducing our 7-week series to problem solving
body:
Become a strong problem solver ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
To further help our readers find the insights they need to thrive in today’s complex business environment, we were delighted earlier this summer to introduce 
McKinsey Publishing Guides
, a free on-demand email series dedicated to personal and professional development. Since then, tens of thousands of subscribers have engaged with our inaugural guides, and we’ve incorporated their feedback into our newest offering: “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to problem solving.
” 
The world's challenges are arguably more complex than they've ever been. This series features a concise set of emails—one per week, for seven weeks—guiding you to become a stronger problem solver. Receive weekly insights and advice from leaders around the world on topics including developing a problem-solving mindset, solving problems in uncertain times, problem solving with AI, and much more. A wrap-up quiz at the end of the series will test your learning as you begin to apply your new skills to your day-to-day challenges.
At the end of this guide, you’ll know how to: 
•
Master communication in problem solving
•
Shift to design thinking
•
Adopt the right problem-solving approach
•
Analyze a problem
… and much more
﻿Sign up now
Looking for more professional development?
In case you missed our first invitation, there’s still time to sign up for our inaugural guides:
•
Click to sign up to “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to managing yourself and others
” (available now, runs for 7 weeks)
•
Click to sign up to “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to excelling as a leader
” (available now, runs for 7 weeks)
Or simply 
click here to sign up for all three guides
 today. And watch for new guides—and new opportunities for professional growth—in the coming months.
Follow our thinking

body:
Dear 
Daniel
,
I hope this email finds you well!
I would like to know how we could add value and be one of your vendors for localization services. Please allow me to introduce my company.
 
TransEv
 
is an 
ISO-certified
 company that has 
5 offices
 around the world. 
We offer high-quality translation and proofreading for English to only Malay 0.06$ per word.
We are ready to offer a 
free-of-charge sample test
 of 
up to 300 words
 to give you a closer look at our quality and commitment.
 
A 
dedicated PM
 function 24/7 even on holidays so that you can know how your project is processing.
 
We specialize in 
Asian and Middle Eastern
 languages. Ultimately, we could provide you with more than 
65 language pairs
. Kindly let me know what are your language demands. 
Moreover, our scope of localization services is very wide. The list of our solutions can go beyond the following:
Translation services. (Proofreading Services, Back Translation, Linguistic Sign Off)

  Website Localization.
  Machine Translation Post-Editing. (MTPE)
  Multimedia Localization. (Transcription, Voice Over, Subtitling).
  Localization Engineering.
  Multimedia Desktop Publishing. (DTP)
  E-Learning Services.
  Publishing & E-Publishing. 
 
Kindly find attached our 
Company Profile, Price list,
 and 
ISO Certification
. 
Note, that the prices above are the standard and we are ready to offer a discount upon the volume.

subject: BLUE KNIGHT™ makes a splash in Q3
body:
Reflections on this year’s Blue Knight Symposium and new announcements.
Not rendering correctly? View this email as a web page
 
here
.
Dear Dan,
The summertime is in full swing, and we are splashing into Q3 with highlights from the BLUE KNIGHT™ Symposium in June.
Hundreds of early-stage companies, investors, funders, and strategic partners from around the globe convened at this year's 
Blue Knight
 Symposium, hosted in association with the BIO International Convention. The event featured inspiring founder stories, key insights on leveraging non-dilutive funding to reach critical inflection points and navigating regulatory challenges, and nearly 90 Curated Connects between 
Blue Knight
 companies and investors and strategic partners. You can check out additional highlights and the on-demand recordings 
here
. 
In addition, we were thrilled to announce the 
Blue Knight
 Resident QuickFire Challenge: Partnering for Preparedness
 awardees - 
Acclinate
, 
Avecris
, 
Decoy Therapeutics Inc.
, 
Jurata Thin Film
, 
Immunyx Pharma
 (partnering with Akagera Medicines, Inc) and 
Neuroene Therapeutics
 (partnering with Epiloid Biotechnology) - who will receive award funding to help them reach their next critical developmental milestones. Congratulations to all participants, your contributions demonstrate the value of partnering to advance global health solutions.
As we celebrate the fourth anniversary of the launch of 
Blue Knight
 throughout August, this year's Symposium served as a testament to the program's growth. Our resident and alumni companies have achieved significant milestones in advancing their solutions to advance health security solutions. 
Thank you to all attendees, speakers and members of the 
Blue Knight
 community for making the Symposium such a success. Keep reading for more updates from 
Blue Knight
 companies below, as we continue to unleash the power of science and technology. 
Rachel Rath
 
Director, BARDA Alliance, Johnson & Johnson Innovation – JLABS 
Hear key takeaways from 
Blue Knight
 leadership on the 2024 
Blue Knight
 Symposium 
Blue Knight
 Buzz
KeViRx
, a 
Blue Knight
 company based at JLABS @ Washington, DC, announce receipt of a $1.99M DoD PRMRP grant award
Tiba Biotech
, a 
Blue Knight
 company based in Boston, MA, joins 
Blue Knight
 with its next-generation nucleic acid delivery technology
Blue Knight
 companies 
Astek Diagnostics
 and 
Solenic Medical
 join MedTech Innovator's 2024 Accelerator Cohort
Astek Diagnostics
, a 
Blue Knight
 company based at JLABS @ Washington, DC, announces seed fund investment from TEDCO
Acclinate
, a 
Blue Knight
 company based at JLABS @ Washington, DC, raises $7M in Series A funding to accelerate health equity 
ENDPOINTS
 spotlights 
Blue Knight
 as a successful BARDA program that fosters innovation and attracts private investment
Uvax Bio
, a 
Blue Knight
 company based at JLABS @ NYC, is currently conducting Phase 1 clinical trials of its new vaccine technology 
ENA Respiratory
, a

subject: Here's how to keep hourly workers in professional roles happy
body:
Download industry-specific information from Employbridge’s Voice of the American workforce report.
 
How you can keep workers in professional roles happy 
Contact a workforce specialist
 
 
Hello there, 
 
Ready for some good news? About 70% of hourly workers who have clerical, accounting and finance, and other professional roles plan to stay in those fields long-term. 
 
But they also want advancement opportunities, higher pay, and to enjoy their work, according to Employbridge’s 2024 Voice of the American Workforce report.  
 
Which means you can’t take their loyalty for granted.  
 
You’ll find more information about what these workers want in the attached flier. Give it a read for insights you can use to retain them.  
 
Download the flier
 
72% of professional talent would work different hours for more pay.
P.S. If you need quality workers for short- or long-term assignments, we’re here to help. 
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097

subject: What's new in the brand center
body:
Hello brand stewards,
We are excited to present you with the most recent brand center updates:
Sector news
Updates have been made to J&J Innovative Medicine and J&J MedTech focus areas in the Brand Architecture & Naming section. View them 
here
.
Data visualization
As we refine data visualization on the brand center, please see 
this document
 for current guidance and guardrails.
 
Brand review process
To support compliant implementation of the new brand expression, you can 
now request
 a brand consultation or submit program names, wordmarks, campaigns, and assets for approval by the brand team.
Our Credo
Our Credo style guide and assets for environmental applications are 
now available
.
 
Environmental design
Connecting our strategy and identity, the 
environmental brand playbook 
documents the principles we follow in manifesting the brand across our global sites.
Branded merchandise
New 
guidelines
 to proudly display our brand on merchandise.
 
Desktop app
The brand center app simplifies searching through libraries. Find logos, templates, illustrations, etc. all in one place. Follow 
these instructions
 on how to download and install the app. PC and MacOS compatible.
 
Product photography
A 
product-focused library
 with J&J MedTech Surgery videos and imagery.
Additional product photography for other focus areas coming soon.
Assets added across our libraries
New and updated assets include: 
MedTech wordmarks
, 
virtual backgrounds
, 
icons
, 
email signature guidelines and templates
, 
business card guidelines
, 
b-roll videos
 and 
photography
 from J&J sites.
 
Global search for libraries
With global search, users can enter asset keywords and the system will generate all assets within the libraries containing searched keywords. For more information, see our updated starter guide 
here
.
Are you new to the brand center?
Welcome! You can 
view
 the brand center starter guide to help you navigate the site.
For returning or frequent users, consider refreshing your knowledge about the brand guidelines and visit our 
training section
. And, don't hesitate to share 
your comments and feedback
 with our team.
Pro-tip
: Do not download assets in bulk for local storage as we frequently update and replace assets. Coming back to the brand center ensures that you are accessing the most up-to-date content.

subject: Introducing our 7-week series to excelling as a leader
body:
Become the most effective leader you can be ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
To further help our readers find the insights they need to thrive in today’s complex business environment, we were delighted last month to introduce 
McKinsey Publishing Guides
, a free email series dedicated to personal and professional development. Since that time, tens of thousands of subscribers have engaged in our inaugural guide, and we’ve incorporated their feedback into our newest offering: “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to excelling as a leader
.” 
Being a leader is arguably more challenging than it’s ever been. This series features a concise set of emails—one per week, for seven weeks—focusing on the skills you need to become the most effective leader you can be. You’ll explore expert insights and advice on topics that should be at the top of your agenda, including gen AI, digital transformations, the changing talent landscape, growth and resilience, and more. A wrap-up quiz at the end of the series will test your learning as you begin to apply your new skills to your day-to-day challenges. 
At the end of this seven-week series, you’ll know how to:
•
Make better decisions
•
Rewire your company for long-term success
•
Navigate the talent landscape 
•
Prioritize growth
… and much more
Sign up now﻿
Looking for more professional development?
In case you missed our first invitation, there’s still time to sign up for our inaugural guide—and to get in early on our fall series:
•
Click to sign up to “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to managing yourself and others
” (available now, runs for 7 weeks)
•
Click to sign up to “
The McKinsey Publishing Guide to problem solving
” (coming in September, runs for 7 weeks)
Or simply 
click here to sign up
 for all three guides today.
Follow our thinking
 
This email contains information about McKinsey’s research, insights, services, or events. By opening our emails or clicking on links, you agree to our use of cookies and web tracking technology. For more information on how we use and protect your information, please review our 
privacy policy
.

body:

The Spectra Diversity and Inclusion Profile™ provides valuable DEI data in one, easy 10 minute assessment. 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Upcoming Webinar: Disability and Brain Health
Date:
 July 15, 12pm CT

 Lee Shull, Co-Founder Sandy Hook Promise, CEO SLS North Star Consulting 
Cost:
 Free
Join us in July for an enlightening session with Spectra Diversity CEO Chris Jones and Lee Shull of SLS North Star Consulting.
Chris will explore Chapter 7 of her book 
Powering Inclusive Cultures: Why Measurement Matters
, addressing common misconceptions about physical and mental disabilities, and providing a roadmap for creating an inclusive workplace.

recruiting and retaining employees with any type of physical or mental disability
steps to add inclusive behavior at work
.

subject: Updates to our terms for AI
body:
Learn how to manage your AI settings. ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ ‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​‌ ​ 
 
 
We recently announced a beta for AI features in Figma Design. In this email, we are sharing 
our approach to building AI
 features and what's next.
To improve these features, we plan to start training AI models to understand design concepts, patterns, file structure, and tooling in Figma. Learn more about how your team can manage AI and our other updates below.
Managing AI settings
Team admins can control how their teams use AI with two new settings for each team they manage:
Whether your team can use AI features 
(on by default for Starter and Professional teams)
.
Whether content is shared for AI training 
(on by default for Starter and Professional teams)
.
AI features and content training are optional.
 Teams can use AI features, even if content training is turned off. Read how to access your AI settings 
here
.
The content training setting goes into effect on August 15th, 2024
. If an admin turns off content training after that, new content and edits will not be used to train AI models.
New AI terms in our policies
The key updates to our 
Terms of Service
 and 
Privacy Policy
 do the following:
Allow Figma to use your team's content to improve AI features, when content training is set to 'on'
Clarify that you retain your rights to content inputted into Figma AI and to the results generated
These new terms will go into effect on August 15, 2024. By continuing to use Figma, including keeping your files with us, you agree to these terms.
If you'd like to read more about Figma's approach to AI, please 
visit our website
. Thank you for using Figma.
The Figma team
Note: This is a legal notice, which is why you are receiving it even if you have opted out of Figma marketing and promotional emails. Replies to this email are not being monitored. Visit our Help Center to learn more.
Figma is a design platform for teams who build products together. Born on the Web, Figma helps the entire product team create, test, and ship better designs, faster.
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
760 Market Street, Floor 10
San Francisco, CA, 94102

subject: 2024 half-year funding: $5.7B across 266 deals
body:
Measured momentum in digital health investment
 
Web Version
 | 
Unsubscribe
 | 
Subscribe
 
 
LinkedIn
 
 
Twitter
 
 
July 8, 2024
Digital health founders and investors are a resilient and adaptable bunch, and H1 2024 showed fruits of their labor. $5.7B was deployed across 266 digital health startup raises in the first half of the year, meaning 2024 could potentially outperform 2023 if investment pace holds. Emerging startups and AI solutions commanded funders’ attention—with early-stage deals (Seed, Series A, and Series B) accounting for 84% of labeled raises, and 34% of total sector funding going to startups leveraging artificial intelligence. The prevalence of unlabeled fundraises also started to taper, suggesting a return to more standard venture patterns with fewer “exceptional” measures needed. Read our 
H1 2024 funding recap
 to digest the past six months of digital health investments, public exits, acquisitions, and more. 
 
Does conducting research and working with Fortune 500 companies on digital health innovation sound like a dream job? Love writing, building slide decks, and consider yourself an Excel whiz? If this sounds like you, 
apply
 to become a Rock Health Advisory Fellow!

, global leader of industries and senior partner & 
Axel Karlsson
, global leader of functional practices and senior partner
New from McKinsey & Company 
﻿Help wanted? Help needed: Labor market challenges
As advanced economies around the world emerged from the 2008 financial crisis, they began an arduous journey toward protracted recovery. Today, labor markets in these advanced economies are still among the tightest in two decades, with the number of job vacancies per unemployed person having increased by more than four times on average by 2023.
How does labor tightness affect economic productivity and output? In this data-driven 
report
 by the McKinsey Global Institute, senior partner 
Olivia White
 and coauthors say that “GDP in 2023 could have been 0.5 percent to 1.5 percent higher across these economies if employers had been able to fill their excess job vacancies.” What’s more, since 2010, countries that have increased GDP fastest have done so primarily by adding more jobs rather than by tackling the harder job of improving productivity. Now, to maintain their current level of growth, advanced economies will need to find ways to both expand the workforce and boost productivity.
To be better prepared for the future, explore these insights to learn more about labor market tightness and the productivity imperative.
﻿Read more
Help wanted: Charting the challenge of tight labor markets in advanced economies
For almost two decades, labor markets across advanced economies have tightened—and the trend is set to continue. This article provides a data-driven look via charts to understand the implications.
Grow the supply-side pie 
The ups and downs of global productivity
Labor productivity over the past 25 years has been a success story for some, a tale of stagnation for others. Investments and digital transformation can boost productivity for all economies, McKinsey research shows.
Tune in
 
Investing in productivity growth
It’s time to raise investment and catch the next productivity wave.
Pave the way 
2024 and beyond: Will it be economic stagnation or the advent of productivity-driven abundance?
Hoping for a soft landing in 2024 won’t mitigate current risks or raise business performance and living standards longer term. If companies pursue the three-sided productivity opportunity, however, they can do both.
Raise your odds of outperformance
 
What is productivity?
Productivity measures the amount of value created for each hour that is worked in a society.
﻿3 ways to unlock productivity
 
The economic potential of generative AI: The next productivity frontier
Generative AI is poised to unleash the next wave of productivity. We take a first look at where business value could accrue and the potential impacts on the workforce.
Harness the power of generative AI
 
A microscope on small businesses: Spotting opportunities to boost productivity
MSMEs are vital for growth and jobs, but struggle with productivity. The route to higher productivity lies in creating a win-win economic fabric for all companies.
View the report 
Human capital at work: The value of experience
Human capital represents two-thirds of wealth for the average individual—and work experience contributes almost half of that value.
Follow the knowledge
 
Today’s skills, tomorrow’s jobs: How will your team fare in the future of work?
Automation will leave few roles untouched—and not everyone will be reskilled or redeployed successfully. Here’s what leaders can do now to give their talent, and their organizations, the best opportunity to thrive in an uncertain future.
Prepare for what’s ahead
 
How to revive US productivity
Boosting US productivity represents a $10 trillion opportunity. Here are strategies CEOs can implement now to lead the US to more prosperity.
﻿Get productive
 
MORE FROM MCKINSEY
Productivity picks up the pace
Global productivity climbed sharply in the past 25 years, thanks in part to 30 “fast lane” economies—meaning those that could reach advanced-economy productivity levels in the next quarter century.
﻿See the chart
 
Gen AI’s productivity possibilities
Using generative AI capabilities in the public sector, healthcare, and education could realize global productivity gains of nearly half a trillion dollars.
﻿See the chart
 
To see more essential reading on topics that matter, visit 
McKinsey Themes
.
— Edited by Esther Chung, editor, Atlanta

subject: Top 10 articles this quarter
body:
At #1: What is generative AI? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

﻿For direct answers to complex questions, check out 
McKinsey Explainers
.
Top Ten Newsletter | Second Quarter 2024
Our top ten articles this quarter look at generative AI, bad bosses, inflation, and more. At No. 1 is “
What is generative AI?
”, which draws on insights from articles by McKinsey’s 
Rodney W. Zemmel
, 
Kate Smaje
, 
Lareina Yee
, 
Michael Chui
, 
Ida Kristensen
, and more.
1. What is generative AI?﻿
Generative artificial intelligence (AI) describes algorithms (such as ChatGPT) that can be used to create new content, including audio, code, images, text, simulations, and videos. Recent breakthroughs in the field have the potential to drastically change the way we approach content creation.
 
Take a comprehensive view
 
 
2. Why so many bad bosses still rise to the top
Narcissism. Overconfidence. Low EQ. Why do we persist in selecting for leadership traits that hamper organizational progress—and leave the right potential leaders in the wrong roles?
 
3 steps forward
 
3. The state of AI in early 2024: Gen AI adoption spikes and starts to generate value﻿
As generative AI adoption accelerates, survey respondents report measurable benefits and increased mitigation of the risk of inaccuracy. A small group of high performers lead the way.﻿
 
See the data
 
 
4. 
What is AI (artificial intelligence)?﻿
Artificial intelligence is a machine’s ability to perform some cognitive functions we usually associate with human minds.
 
Get up to speed
 
5. 
What’s the future of AI?﻿
AI is here to stay. To outcompete in the future, organizations and individuals alike need to get familiar fast. This series of 
McKinsey Explainers
 dives deep into the seven technologies that are already shaping the years to come.
 
Machine learning, deep learning, and more
 
6. 
Moving past gen AI’s honeymoon phase: Seven hard truths for CIOs to get from pilot to scale﻿
Getting to scale requires CIOs to focus on fewer things but do them better.
 
Get to scale with gen AI
 
7. 
What is inflation?﻿
Inflation is the gradual loss of purchasing power, reflected in a broad rise in prices for goods and services.
 
Understand the current moment
 
8. 
How to prepare for the CFO role﻿
Amid decade-high CFO turnover, former chief financial officers share advice on what matters most today for securing the top job in finance.
 
Make big bets
 
9. 
A new future of work: The race to deploy AI and raise skills in Europe and beyond ﻿
To gain the full productivity benefits of generative AI and other technologies, Europe and the United States will need to focus both on improving human capital and accelerating technology adoption.
 
Seize the moment
 
10. 
Increasing your return on talent: The moves and metrics that matter﻿
Five actions can transform an organization’s talent system, establishing a culture of performance while boosting employee experience.
 
5 transformative actions

subject: Take an unbiased approach to decision making
body:
Shake the assumption ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
THIS MONTH’S PAGE-TURNERS ON BUSINESS AND BEYOND
You have a hunch that your store’s fourth-quarter sales are down because of online shopping. You complete an analysis of shoppers who purchased online more often this quarter than last. The solution is simple: You need an online store, right? Wrong. You may have just solved a problem that didn’t exist; something else could be amiss. All too often, many engage in confirmation bias—making assumptions based on preexisting beliefs. Bias could affect important business and personal decisions. It could also lead to costly mistakes and missed opportunities. To gain a more balanced perspective, take a few steps back. Start with an empty canvas, or even better, that blank first page of a book.
This edition of 
Readers & Leaders
 sheds light on the foibles of decision making. Rockefeller International chairman Ruchir Sharma discusses why government’s 
predetermined solution to economic disaster won’t avert a crisis
 but contributes to one. Elspeth Kirman, Nesta’s chief program officer, highlights the 
impact of bias on constructive decision making
 and explains why the worst form of bias is inactivity. American University professor Aram Sinnreich shares why solely exploring data that support an argument rather than 
letting data drive discovery
 could be a recipe for failure. Read on to see how a more neutral viewpoint could help avert bias and improve outcomes.
Want early access to interviews?
 
Download the McKinsey Insights app
 to read the latest 
Author Talks
 now.
it bears repeating
“Why is the number of start-up businesses in America declining? Why are economic and social mobility declining? These are issues that require serious introspection. Solutions are often offered. The easy fix is to ‘throw more money at the problem.’ If you keep doing that, you will repeatedly see more of the same issues you’ve seen over the last 20 to 30 years...”
—Ruchir Sharma, chairman of Rockefeller International and founder and chief investment officer of Breakout Capital, 
in a June edition of 
Author Talks
.
IN CASE YOU MISSED IT
 
Can thinking like an artist improve your decisions?﻿
As artists arrange objects on a canvas, they do four things deliberately that other people don’t. Elspeth Kirkman says doing those four things—and tackling our biases along the way—can lead to better choices.
Trade in your biases
 
 
How data takes on a life of its own—and what you can do about it﻿
Data permeates almost every aspect of our lives, but do we truly know its effects? Aram Sinnreich looks behind the curtain to find out.﻿
Read more
 
﻿
TURN BACK THE PAGE
Put your bias-busting skills to the test as you explore these interviews:
1. 
Think you’re foolproof? It could be hurting your decision making
2. 
How to remove unconscious bias from the workplace
3. 
Dismantling double standards in business with CNBC’s Julia Boorstin
4. 
Howard Friedman on getting the most from your data science team
BUSINESS BESTSELLERS TOP
8
Catch up on the latest and greatest reads for the month. Explore May’s business bestsellers, prepared exclusively for McKinsey by Circana. Check out the full selection on 
McKinsey on Books
﻿
.
BUSINESS OVERALL
Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
 by James Clear (Penguin Group USA)
BUSINESS HARDCOVER
Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
 by James Clear (Penguin Group USA)
ECONOMICS
In This Economy? How Money & Markets Really Work
 by Kyla Scanlon (Random House
)
DECISION MAKING
The Venture Mindset: How to Make Smarter Bets and Achieve Extraordinary Growth
 
by Ilya Strebulaev and Alex Dang (Penguin Group USA)
ORGANIZATIONAL BEHAVIOR
Atomic Habits: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones
 by James Clear (Penguin Group USA)
WORKPLACE CULTURE
Impact Players: How to Take the Lead, Play Bigger, and Multiply Your Impact
 by Liz Wiseman (HarperCollins Publishers)﻿
COMPUTERS & AI
What Is ChatGPT Doing . . . and Why Does It Work?
 by Stephen Wolfram (John Wiley & Sons)
SUSTAINABILITY
Venture Meets Mission: Aligning People, Purpose, and Profit to Innovate and Transform Society
 
by Arun Gupta, Gerard George, and Thomas J. Fewer (Stanford University Press)
BOOKMARK THIS
The Journey of Leadership: How CEOs Learn to Lead from the Inside Out﻿
The Journey of Leadership
 (Portfolio/Penguin Group), McKinsey’s next major book, will publish in the United States and the United Kingdom on September 10. The book, by senior partners 
Dana Maor
, 
Kurt Strovink
, 
Ramesh Srinivasan
, and senior partner emeritus 
Hans-Werner Kaas
, is the first-ever explanation of McKinsey’s step-by-step approach to transforming leaders both professionally and personally—including revealing lessons from its legendary CEO leadership program, the “Bower Forum,” which has counseled more than 500 global CEOs over the past decade. It’s a journey that helps leaders hone the psychological, emotional, and, ultimately, human attributes that result in success in today’s most demanding top job.
Preorder now
 
﻿
McKinsey on Lives & Legacie
s﻿
This monthly series provides a look at the obituaries of influential leaders. Learn more about these luminaries and how they have inspired generations.﻿
Learn more
 
﻿
Coming soon
﻿
Curious about the books that global leaders are reading? Stay tuned for our annual reading guide, which launches in July. Discover which selections executives have on their shelves and why.﻿
If you’d like to propose a book or author for 
#McKAuthorTalks
, please email us at 
Author_Talks@McKinsey.com
. Due to the high volume of requests, we will respond only to those being considered.

subject: You're invited! Join us for a virtual event on tight labor markets in advanced economies
body:

Learn more about McKinsey Global Institute
New from McKinsey & Company
﻿Help wanted: Charting the challenge of tight labor markets in advanced economies﻿
Labor markets in advanced economies are exceptionally tight today. This tightness isn’t the lingering effects of the COVID-19 pandemic but rather a sustained trend driven by aging workforces and labor demand outstripping supply. Continued tightness comes at an economic cost, increasing the impetus for business leaders and policymakers to come up with new approaches to boost participation and productivity to offset its impact.
Join us on 
Tuesday, July 30 at 11:00AM-12:00PM EDT
 (5:00PM-6:00PM CEST) for a discussion on 
MGI’s latest research
 that examines labor market conditions in advanced economies, highlighting dynamics across sectors and occupations, future supply trends, and strategies to mitigate labor shortages.  
This virtual event will include a presentation by the authors followed by a panel with leading labor market experts who will discuss: ﻿
•
Countries and sectors that are most impacted by labor shortages
•
The economic consequences of labor shortages
•
The role of AI and other technology
•
Actions employers and policymakers can take to improve labor supply and productivity
Once registered, you will receive an email confirmation and can add the event to your calendar. Registrants who can't attend live will receive a recording of the event.

subject: Empowering community health workers
body:
Announcing our investment in Pear Suite
 
Web Version
 | 
Unsubscribe
 | 
Subscribe
 
 
LinkedIn
 
 
Twitter
 
 
June 24, 2024
Community health workers (
CHWs
) play an increasingly critical role in the U.S. healthcare delivery system. They provide a wide range of 
services
, from health promotion and education to care coordination and social support. And there is a growing body of evidence that CHW interventions have a significant positive 
impact
 on health outcomes and costs.
Momentum is building for community health workers to drive even greater impact. Significant investments in 
workforce development
 and rapidly increasing Medicaid 
coverage
 for CHW services mean there is a growing CHW workforce with access to reimbursement dollars. Yet most CHWs and the community-based organizations (CBOs) that employ them have no experience submitting healthcare claims.
This is where 
Pear Suite
 comes in. Pear Suite’s SaaS platform enables the rapidly growing CHW workforce to standardize the data they collect, improve care navigation, and access reimbursement. The company partners with payers and CBOs to address the social drivers of health in a scalable, cost-effective, and person-centered way.
Today Rock Health Capital is 
announcing our most recent investment
 in Pear Suite, alongside Flare Capital Partners, AARP, and California Health Care Foundation. 
Learn more
 about how Pear Suite is empowering community health workers to address the social drivers of health. 
The Rock Health Summit speaker lineup is taking shape and we’re excited to share a sneak peek of who you’ll see on stage on September 10. You’ll hear unique perspectives and fresh ideas from Sara Vaezy (Providence), Monique Woodard (Cake Ventures), Blake Madden (Hospitalogy), Ashley Edwards (MindRight Health), Mohana Ravindranath (STAT), Joanna Strober (Midi Health)—and more!

.
Top Ten Reports | Second Quarter 2024
Our top ten reports this quarter look at topics such as productivity growth, Hollywood, small businesses, tourism, and, of course, artificial intelligence. At No. 1 is "
A new future of work: The race to deploy AI and raise skills in Europe and beyond
" by McKinsey's 
Eric Hazan
, 
Anu Madgavkar
, 
Michael Chui
, 
Sven Smit
, 
Dana Maor
, and coauthors.
1. A new future of work: The race to deploy AI and raise skills in Europe and beyond [68 pages]﻿
To gain the full productivity benefits of generative AI and other technologies, Europe and the United States will need to focus both on improving human capital and accelerating technology adoption.
 
Seize the moment
 
 
2. The state of tourism and hospitality 2024 [68 pages]
﻿Tourism and hospitality are set to soar, powered by new travelers, destinations, and trends.
 
Read more
 
3. Steady progress in approaching the quantum advantage [103 pages]﻿
Quantum technology could create value worth trillions of dollars within the next decade. The third annual 
Quantum Technology Monitor
 synthesizes the latest opportunities in this burgeoning field.
 
Discover the latest trends
 
 
4. 
A microscope on small businesses: Spotting opportunities to boost productivity [56 pages]
MSMEs are vital for growth and jobs, but struggle with productivity. The route to higher productivity lies in creating a win-win economic fabric for all companies.
 
View the report
 
5. 
State of Grocery Europe 2024: Signs of Hope [44 pages]
Although economic uncertainty will likely persist in 2024, grocery retailers could fuel profitable growth by future-proofing the assortment, driving efficiency savings, and monetizing retail media.
 
8 trends
 
6. 
Space: The $1.8 trillion opportunity for global economic growth [52 pages]﻿
As the space economy expands, it could create value for multiple industries and solve many of the world’s most pressing challenges.
 
Reach for the stars
 
7. 
AI for social good: Improving lives and protecting the planet [29 pages]﻿
As AI advances from predictive to generative capabilities, its potential to address social issues defined by the UN Sustainable Development Goals expands.
 
Potential, challenges, and risks
 
8. 
From margins to mainstream: Asians and Pacific Islanders in Hollywood [27 pages]﻿
Asian and Pacific Islander consumers could generate billions of dollars in additional revenue—if the film and television industry can improve the representation and authenticity of API content.
 
Representation matters
 
9. 
Netherlands advanced: Building a future labor market that works [56 pages]﻿
The Netherlands has high ambitions for living standards, housing, healthcare, education, and the environment, requiring higher productivity growth through technology and a “train of job transitions.”
 
Get to work
 
10. 
McKinsey China Auto Consumer Insights 2024 [48 pages]﻿
Results from a new McKinsey survey reveal how consumer preferences for vehicles are evolving within China, one of the world’s most important automotive markets.
 
Read more
 
MORE FROM MCKINSEY
2023 ESG Report: Accelerating sustainable and inclusive growth for all [89 pages]
We are driving measurable progress towards sustainable and inclusive growth in the societies where we operate. Our 2023 ESG report details how we are making an impact through our client work, insights, actions, and giving.
Read more
 
﻿

subject: Lotis Blue Consulting Joins Sullivan Cotter Holdings, Inc.
body:
We are pleased to announce that Lotis Blue Consulting has been acquired by Sullivan Cotter Holdings, Inc.
 
Breaking News
Lotis Blue Consulting joins Sullivan Cotter Holdings, Inc.
We are pleased to announce that 
Lotis Blue Consulting has been acquired by Sullivan Cotter Holdings Inc
.
, the parent company of 
SullivanCotter
, 
Clinician Nexus
, and 
C3 Nonprofit Consulting Group
. 
Lotis Blue Consulting will continue to operate under its current name, providing you with enhanced capabilities and resources.
 We will continue to deliver our renowned and proprietary approach that combines data and behavioral science to elevate workforce, leadership, and organizational performance in service of strategy execution.
This unique positioning in the market has been credited with realizing sustained client results, earning us recognition from Forbes for the past three years as one of America’s best management consulting firms. Moreover, we will continue to serve clients across all verticals while expanding more deeply into the healthcare industry.
Joining Sullivan Cotter Holdings, Inc. allows us to bring more talent, technology, and scale to build on our reputation for delivering business impact through strategy-led organization design, talent management, and improving the performance of executive teams and leaders.
Rest assured, our commitment to serving you remains as strong as ever and our goal is to ensure a seamless transition with minimal disruption to your experience. 
In summary, our integration into Sullivan Cotter Holdings Inc. represents a significant step forward for Lotis Blue Consulting and reinforces our commitment to providing you with best-in-class consulting services. We are excited about the opportunities that lie ahead and look forward to continuing our partnership with you.
Read the press release
 
Should you have any questions or concerns about this transition, please feel free to contact us directly. Your satisfaction and peace of mind are our top priorities, and we are here to support you every step of the way.
Thank you for your continued trust and partnership. We are genuinely excited about the journey ahead and the opportunity to deliver even greater value to your organization.
Kind regards,
Lotis Blue Consulting
 
Lotis Blue Consulting, 200 West Adams Street, Suite 2900, Chicago, Illinois 60606, United States

body:

Create the future with generative AI.
Welcome to a new era of creativity and the future of creative productivity in the enterprise. Join us in New York City to discover how you can infuse generative AI into your team’s workflows, and get insights from leaders at PepsiCo and Razorfish. 
Make it. NYC in-person event.
June 27 | Noon-5:30pm ET | Edison Ballroom

We’re introducing new terms on the use of Miro AI features
On July 17, 2024, we’re introducing a new 
AI Features Addendum
 that will supplement the agreement you have with Miro. We’re also updating the 
Miro Privacy Policy 
. These changes make it easier for you to understand what to expect from Miro as you use our AI features, such as Miro Assist.
You can review the new terms 
here
. At a glance, these updates explain:
•
How Miro uses inputs you provide and output generated by Miro AI features.
•
Ownership of output generated by Miro’s AI features.
•
Limitations associated with the quickly-evolving technologies that underpin Miro AI features.
You don't have to do anything to accept these changes. By continuing to use Miro after July 17th you are agreeing to the new terms. If you have questions check the FAQ below.
AI Features Addendum FAQ
We don’t train generative AI with your board content.
 Miro relies on commercially available models (such as developed by OpenAI) as well as open-source models that are trained with licensed data and public domain content where copyright has expired. Miro may use usage data and other meta data to improve your product experience and develop features like diagramming and sticky clustering.
You can choose not to participate in our AI feature improvement efforts.
 We currently don’t use your input into and output from Miro AI features to improve our product. If we intend to change our training approach, we will inform you upfront.
You own your board content.
 No license granted to Miro to operate its services will supersede your ownership rights.
Thank you for using Miro! 
The Miro Team
You have received this mandatory email service announcement to update you about important changes in connection with Miro’s Terms of Service. You are a subject to Miro's Terms of Service because you have an account with Miro. 
Please do not reply to this email, as we are unable to respond from this email address. If you need support, please visit 
Miro’s Help Center
.
 
This email was sent to 
d.gough@lcwmail.com
. 
 
Miro, 201 Spear St., Suite 1100
San Francisco, CA 94105, United States
 
Help Center

subject: Workers want upskilling – how do we know?
body:
Hourly workers in most industries want to learn new skills as a way to boost their pay, according to our 2024 Voice of the American Workforce survey. 
 
Hello there, 
 
Your talent wants the opportunity to learn new skills. 
 
They recognize that the workplace is changing, and they want to be prepared.
 
Give them what they want—and earn their loyalty—by offering courses to help them upskill. 
 
For students in our Better Worklife Academy, we’ve found that: 
96% feel they perform better than, or on par with, their coworkers
50% higher tenure, on average, is reported for workers who enroll in Better Worklife Academy
83% feel more confident in their skill sets
Topics covered in Better Worklife Academy courses include industry-specific content—like CNC machining and electrical maintenance—as well as industrial math and supervising the front line. We offer these courses to our talent and yours at no cost to them. 
 
Want to learn more? 
Learn more about upskilling here
 
Contact us today to learn how we can support you.
P.S. Workers are interested in gaining skills in automation and robotics. Learn more by downloading our 
Voice of the American Workforce report
.
 
Employbridge, 1845 Satellite Blvd., Suite 300, Duluth, GA 30097
Employbridge © 2024. All rights reserved.

subject: Supporting mental health and addiction recovery
body:
Announcing our investment in Marigold Health
 
Web Version
 | 
Unsubscribe
 | 
Subscribe
 
 
LinkedIn
 
 
Twitter
 
 
June 17, 2024
While striking, unfortunately the following 
statistics
 are likely unsurprising: 23% of the U.S. population has a mental illness and 17% has a substance use disorder—but only half of those needing mental health treatment, and a quarter of those needing substance use treatment, receive it.
Enter 
Marigold Health
, which offers an anonymous social network where people with mental health and substance use conditions support each other. The company’s AI-powered platform enables certified peer recovery coaches to reach and serve those most in need. Marigold works with providers as well as payers—typically Medicaid and Dual Eligible plans covering medically complex and vulnerable populations—providing 24/7 service to members.
Rock Health Capital is excited to 
announce our investment
 in 
Marigold’s $11M Series A
, which we co-led with Innospark Ventures, alongside investment from Commonwealth Care Alliance, Wavemaker360, Stand Together Ventures Lab, Epsilon Health Investors, Koa Labs, VNS Health Plan and KdT Ventures. 
Learn more
 about how Marigold is expanding access to high-quality peer support.

subject: The quarter’s top themes
body:
At #1: What's the future of AI? ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌   ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ 
 
Share this email
 
 
Share this email on 
LinkedIn
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Twitter
  
 
 
Share this email on 
Facebook
  
 
 
 
STILL INTERESTED?
We hope you enjoy hearing from us and want to continue getting the emails you’ve signed up for. Let us know.
Yes, I'm still interested
For direct answers to complex questions, check out 
McKinsey Explainers
.
﻿Top Ten McKinsey Themes │ Second Quarter 2024
In the second quarter of 2024, our top ten posts from 
McKinsey Themes
 highlighted topics including generative AI, the traits of good bosses, and more. At No. 1 is 
What's the future of AI?
, which draws on insights from articles by McKinsey’s 
Eric Lamarre
, 
Rodney W. Zemmel
, 
Kate Smaje
, 
Michael Chui
, 
Ida Kristensen
, and more. Read on for our full top 10.
1. What’s the future of AI?
We’re in the midst of a revolution. Just as steam power, mechanized engines, and coal supply chains transformed the world in the 18th century, AI technology is currently changing the face of work, our economies, and society as we know it.
 
﻿7 technologies for the future
 
 
2. 100 articles on generative AI
Since generative AI (gen AI) burst onto the scene in late 2022, it’s captivated business leaders and society at large. The excitement is well deserved: McKinsey research indicates that gen AI could add the equivalent of $2.6 trillion to $4.4 trillion of value annually—and redefine the way people work and live.
 
﻿Plus, our top 10
 
3. How to be a better boss
It’s often said that your manager can make or break your experience at a job. Unfortunately, it seems that almost everyone can recall working under a bad boss at least once in their career. How do so many bad leaders come into a position of power in the first place, and why do they remain there?
 
﻿Traits that make great leaders
 
 
4. 
What do employees really want out of generative AI?
As the use of generative AI (gen AI) becomes more common in the workplace, organizations are focused on how the technology can increase productivity levels.
 
﻿Humanize gen-AI productivity
 
5. 
Spring cleaning—for your mind
It’s as if nature itself whispers the call. As the days get longer and warmer, the urge to purge our homes of the clutter, dust, and grime that accumulated in the cold winter season grows. But it's not just our living spaces that crave a thorough spring cleaning.
 
﻿10 must-reads
 
6. 
Insights from our newest senior partners
McKinsey recently announced the election of 54 new senior partners, representing 17 practices and 35 offices around the world.
 
﻿Meet the new senior partners
 
7. 
Remembering Daniel Kahneman
Daniel Kahneman, author, economist, and psychologist who was awarded the Nobel Prize in Economic Science in 2002 for his seminal work on human judgment and decision making, passed away on March 27 at the age of 90.
 
Insights on human judgment, decision making, and more
 
8. 
The McKinsey CEO Interview
Did you know that McKinsey partners regularly speak with top CEOs across industries to glean valuable perspectives? Our recent and best interviews cover a range of topics, from navigating disruption to effective crisis leadership. Dive into our curated selection below for insights from these impactful leaders, and learn what it takes to thrive in today's uniquely challenging business environment.
 
﻿Get perspective
 
9. 
What’s the world without innovation?
Innovation is the lifeblood of progress and the driving force behind the advancement of sustainable development goals.
 
﻿Let's get creative
 
10. 
What new grads can expect when they enter the workforce
New grads are hanging up their caps, gowns, and stoles, and preparing to enter the world of work—and it looks quite different than it did a few years ago.
 
﻿Be prepared for changes
 
Follow our thinking
 
Share these insights
Did you enjoy this newsletter?
 
Forward it to colleagues and friends
 so they can subscribe too. Was this issue forwarded to you? Sign up for it and sample our 40+ other free email subscriptions
 
here
.

subject: Movement in MSK
body:
Virtual PT limbers up
 
Web Version
 | 
Unsubscribe
 | 
Subscribe
 
 
LinkedIn
 
 
Twitter
 
 
June 10, 2024
It was a busy week in digital musculoskeletal (MSK) health, with raises, product launches, and an outcomes report drawing attention to innovations in MSK care. In conjunction with its 
$130M
 mega deal, digital physical therapy platform 
Sword Health
 announced a new interactive 
AI feature
 that can guide patients through virtual physical therapy (PT) sessions. The next day, Peterson Health Technology Institute (PHTI) 
reported
 that some virtual MSK solutions may be effective substitutes for in-person PT, and sometimes at lower costs. Combined with ongoing 
IPO speculation
 from 
Hinge Health
, the digital health MSK market is limbering up. Outcomes reporting and funding momentum are paving the way for continued investor and market attention—MSK digital health solutions have raised $223M so far this year, already nearly double that of 2023’s $125M. 
Don’t miss out! Applications for the 2024 RockHealth.org Innovation Fellowship are due Thursday, June 20. The Fellowship is an immersive cohort-based experience that supports and amplifies the work of visionary leaders who are centering lived experience in digital health innovation. Learn more and 
apply today
!

subject: Webinar: LGBTQ Inclusion in the Workplace
body:
You don't often get email from info@spectradiversity.com. 
Learn why this is important
Register now to secure your spot and mark your calendar for an enriching experience that promises to transform your leadership perspective.
 
The Spectra Diversity and Inclusion Profile™ provides valuable DEI data in one, easy 10 minute assessment. 
View this email in your browser
 
 
Upcoming Webinar: Are People of All Sexual Orientations Welcome in Your Workplace?
Date:
 June 10, 12pm CT
Featured Speaker:
 Jamie Moyer, Within-Collective
Cost:
 Free
Join us in June for an enlightening session with Spectra Diversity CEO Chris Jones and Jamie Moyer of the Within-Collective.
Chris will explore Chapter 6 of her book Powering Inclusive Cultures: Why Measurement Matters, addressing common misconceptions about sexual orientation and providing a roadmap for creating an inclusive workplace.
It's PRIDE month and Jamie will share insights on supporting LGBTQ+ colleagues, emphasizing the importance of being true allies. 
Jamie will share how you can:
Have conversations and give meaningful feedback.
Speak up confidently and advocate for others.
Overcome shame, inauthenticity and fear.
Don’t let this opportunity pass you by!
 
Register now
 to secure your free spot and mark your calendar for an enriching experience that promises to transform your leadership perspective.
 
Let's Make a Difference Together
 Your participation is crucial in shaping a future where every individual feels valued and included. Share this opportunity with your team and network to amplify the impact of our collective efforts in fostering inclusive cultures.
Thank you for your commitment to making inclusivity a core part of your leadership journey. We look forward to seeing you June 10th.
